00:00.text: Genesis - The Beginning: In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth

00:01.text: In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.

00:02.text: And the earth was without form, and void; and darkness was upon the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters.

00:03.text: And God said, Let there be light: and there was light.

00:04.text: And God saw the light, that it was good: and God divided the light from the darkness.

00:05.text: And God called the light Day, and the darkness he called Night. And the evening and the morning were the first day.

00:06.text: And God said, Let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters.

00:07.text: And God made the firmament, and divided the waters which were under the firmament from the waters which were above the firmament: and it was so.

00:08.text: And God called the firmament Heaven. And the evening and the morning were the second day.

00:09.text: And God said, Let the waters under the heaven be gathered together unto one place, and let the dry land appear: and it was so.

00:10.text: And God called the dry land Earth; and the gathering together of the waters called he Seas: and God saw that it was good.

00:11.text: And God said, Let the earth bring forth grass, the herb yielding seed, and the fruit tree yielding fruit after his kind, whose seed is in itself, upon the earth: and it was so.

00:12.text: And the earth brought forth grass, and herb yielding seed after his kind, and the tree yielding fruit, whose seed was in itself, after his kind: and God saw that it was good.

00:13.text: And the evening and the morning were the third day.

00:14.text: And God said, Let there be lights in the firmament of the heaven to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days, and years:

00:15.text: And let them be for lights in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth: and it was so.

00:16.text: And God made two great lights; the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night: he made the stars also.

00:17.text: And God set them in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth,

00:18.text: And to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness: and God saw that it was good.

00:19.text: And the evening and the morning were the fourth day.

00:20.text: And God said, Let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl that may fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.

00:21.text: And God created great whales, and every living creature that moveth, which the waters brought forth abundantly, after their kind, and every winged fowl after his kind: and God saw that it was good.

00:22.text: And God blessed them, saying, Be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let fowl multiply in the earth.

00:23.text: And the evening and the morning were the fifth day.

00:24.text: And God said, Let the earth bring forth the living creature after his kind, cattle, and creeping thing, and beast of the earth after his kind: and it was so.

00:25.text: And God made the beast of the earth after his kind, and cattle after their kind, and every thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind: and God saw that it was good.

00:26.text: And God said, Let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.

00:27.text: So God created man in his own image, in the image of God created he him; male and female created he them.

00:28.text: And God blessed them, and God said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth, and subdue it: and have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over every living thing that moveth upon the earth.

00:29.text: And God said, Behold, I have given you every herb bearing seed, which is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree, in the which is the fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it shall be for meat.

00:30.text: And to every beast of the earth, and to every fowl of the air, and to every thing that creepeth upon the earth, wherein there is life, I have given every green herb for meat: and it was so.

00:31.text: And God saw every thing that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. And the evening and the morning were the sixth day.

00:32.text: Thus the heavens and the earth were finished, and all the host of them.

00:33.text: And on the seventh day God ended his work which he had made; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made.

00:34.text: And God blessed the seventh day, and sanctified it: because that in it he had rested from all his work which God created and made.

00:35.text: These are the generations of the heavens and of the earth when they were created, in the day that the LORD God made the earth and the heavens,

00:36.text: And every plant of the field before it was in the earth, and every herb of the field before it grew: for the LORD God had not caused it to rain upon the earth, and there was not a man to till the ground.

00:37.text: But there went up a mist from the earth, and watered the whole face of the ground.

00:38.text: And the LORD God formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.

00:39.text: And the LORD God planted a garden eastward in Eden; and there he put the man whom he had formed.

00:40.text: And out of the ground made the LORD God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.

00:41.text: And a river went out of Eden to water the garden; and from thence it was parted, and became into four heads.

00:42.text: The name of the first is Pison: that is it which compasseth the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold;

00:43.text: And the gold of that land is good: there is bdellium and the onyx stone.

00:44.text: And the name of the second river is Gihon: the same is it that compasseth the whole land of Ethiopia.

00:45.text: And the name of the third river is Hiddekel: that is it which goeth toward the east of Assyria. And the fourth river is Euphrates.

00:46.text: And the LORD God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it.

00:47.text: And the LORD God commanded the man, saying, Of every tree of the garden thou mayest freely eat:

00:48.text: But of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, thou shalt not eat of it: for in the day that thou eatest thereof thou shalt surely die.

00:49.text: And the LORD God said, It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him an help meet for him.

00:50.text: And out of the ground the LORD God formed every beast of the field, and every fowl of the air; and brought them unto Adam to see what he would call them: and whatsoever Adam called every living creature, that was the name thereof.

00:51.text: And Adam gave names to all cattle, and to the fowl of the air, and to every beast of the field; but for Adam there was not found an help meet for him.

00:52.text: And the LORD God caused a deep sleep to fall upon Adam, and he slept: and he took one of his ribs, and closed up the flesh instead thereof;

00:53.text: And the rib, which the LORD God had taken from man, made he a woman, and brought her unto the man.

00:54.text: And Adam said, This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh: she shall be called Woman, because she was taken out of Man.

00:55.text: Therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave unto his wife: and they shall be one flesh.

00:56.text: And they were both naked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed.

00:57.text: In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.

00:58.text: So God created man in his own image, in the image of God created he him; male and female created he them.

00:59.text: And the LORD God formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.

01:00.text: Matthew Chapter 1 - The Genealogy of Jesus Christ

01:01.text: The book of the generation of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.

01:02.text: Abraham begat Isaac; and Isaac begat Jacob; and Jacob begat Judas and his brethren;

01:03.text: And Judas begat Phares and Zara of Thamar; and Phares begat Esrom; and Esrom begat Aram;

01:04.text: And Aram begat Aminadab; and Aminadab begat Naasson; and Naasson begat Salmon;

01:05.text: And Salmon begat Booz of Rachab; and Booz begat Obed of Ruth; and Obed begat Jesse;

01:06.text: And Jesse begat David the king; and David the king begat Solomon of her that had been the wife of Urias;

01:07.text: And Solomon begat Roboam; and Roboam begat Abia; and Abia begat Asa;

01:08.text: And Asa begat Josaphat; and Josaphat begat Joram; and Joram begat Ozias;

01:09.text: And Ozias begat Joatham; and Joatham begat Achaz; and Achaz begat Ezekias;

01:10.text: And Ezekias begat Manasses; and Manasses begat Amon; and Amon begat Josias;

01:11.text: And Josias begat Jechonias and his brethren, about the time they were carried away to Babylon:

01:12.text: And after they were brought to Babylon, Jechonias begat Salathiel; and Salathiel begat Zorobabel;

01:13.text: And Zorobabel begat Abiud; and Abiud begat Eliakim; and Eliakim begat Azor;

01:14.text: And Azor begat Sadoc; and Sadoc begat Achim; and Achim begat Eliud;

01:15.text: And Eliud begat Eleazar; and Eleazar begat Matthan; and Matthan begat Jacob;

01:16.text: And Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.

01:17.text: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations; and from David until the carrying away into Babylon are fourteen generations; and from the carrying away into Babylon unto Christ are fourteen generations.

01:18.text: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was on this wise: When as his mother Mary was espoused to Joseph, before they came together, she was found with child of the Holy Ghost.

01:19.text: Then Joseph her husband, being a just man, and not willing to make her a publick example, was minded to put her away privily.

01:20.text: But while he thought on these things, behold, the angel of the LORD appeared unto him in a dream, saying, Joseph, thou son of David, fear not to take unto thee Mary thy wife: for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Ghost.

01:21.text: And she shall bring forth a son, and thou shalt call his name JESUS: for he shall save his people from their sins.

01:22.text: Now all this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, saying,

01:23.text: Behold, a virgin shall be with child, and shall bring forth a son, and they shall call his name Emmanuel, which being interpreted is, God with us.

01:24.text: Then Joseph being raised from sleep did as the angel of the Lord had bidden him, and took unto him his wife:

01:25.text: And knew her not till she had brought forth her firstborn son: and he called his name JESUS.

01:26.text: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judaea in the days of Herod the king, behold, there came wise men from the east to Jerusalem,

01:27.text: Saying, Where is he that is born King of the Jews? for we have seen his star in the east, and are come to worship him.

01:28.text: When Herod the king had heard these things, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.

01:29.text: And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together, he demanded of them where Christ should be born.

01:30.text: And they said unto him, In Bethlehem of Judaea: for thus it is written by the prophet,

01:31.text: And thou Bethlehem, in the land of Juda, art not the least among the princes of Juda: for out of thee shall come a Governor, that shall rule my people Israel.

01:32.text: Then Herod, when he had privily called the wise men, enquired of them diligently what time the star appeared.

01:33.text: And he sent them to Bethlehem, and said, Go and search diligently for the young child; and when ye have found him, bring me word again, that I may come and worship him also.

01:34.text: When they had heard the king, they departed; and, lo, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, till it came and stood over where the young child was.

01:35.text: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceeding great joy.

01:36.text: And when they were come into the house, they saw the young child with Mary his mother, and fell down, and worshipped him: and when they had opened their treasures, they presented unto him gifts; gold, and frankincense, and myrrh.

01:37.text: And being warned of God in a dream that they should not return to Herod, they departed into their own country another way.

01:38.text: And when they were departed, behold, the angel of the Lord appeareth to Joseph in a dream, saying, Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and be thou there until I bring thee word: for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him.

01:39.text: When he arose, he took the young child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt:

01:40.text: And was there until the death of Herod: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, saying, Out of Egypt have I called my son.

01:41.text: Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked of the wise men, was exceeding wroth, and sent forth, and slew all the children that were in Bethlehem, and in all the coasts thereof, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had diligently enquired of the wise men.

01:42.text: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet, saying,

01:43.text: In Rama was there a voice heard, lamentation, and weeping, and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children, and would not be comforted, because they are not.

01:44.text: But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeareth in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,

01:45.text: Saying, Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel: for they are dead which sought the young child's life.

01:46.text: And he arose, and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.

01:47.text: But when he heard that Archelaus did reign in Judaea in the room of his father Herod, he was afraid to go thither: notwithstanding, being warned of God in a dream, he turned aside into the parts of Galilee:

01:48.text: And he came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophets, He shall be called a Nazarene.

01:49.text: In those days came John the Baptist, preaching in the wilderness of Judaea,

01:50.text: And saying, Repent ye: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.

01:51.text: For this is he that was spoken of by the prophet Esaias, saying, The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.

01:52.text: And the same John had his raiment of camel's hair, and a leathern girdle about his loins; and his meat was locusts and wild honey.

01:53.text: Then went out to him Jerusalem, and all Judaea, and all the region round about Jordan,

01:54.text: And were baptized of him in Jordan, confessing their sins.

01:55.text: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees come to his baptism, he said unto them, O generation of vipers, who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

01:56.text: Bring forth therefore fruits meet for repentance:

01:57.text: And think not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham to our father: for I say unto you, that God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.

01:58.text: And now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees: therefore every tree which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.

01:59.text: I indeed baptize you with water unto repentance: but he that cometh after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to bear: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost, and with fire:

02:00.text: Luke Chapter 2 - The Birth of Jesus

02:01.text: And it came to pass in those days, that there went out a decree from Caesar Augustus, that all the world should be taxed.

02:02.text: (And this taxing was first made when Cyrenius was governor of Syria.)

02:03.text: And all went to be taxed, every one into his own city.

02:04.text: And Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judaea, unto the city of David, which is called Bethlehem; (because he was of the house and lineage of David:)

02:05.text: To be taxed with Mary his espoused wife, being great with child.

02:06.text: And so it was, that, while they were there, the days were accomplished that she should be delivered.

02:07.text: And she brought forth her firstborn son, and wrapped him in swaddling clothes, and laid him in a manger; because there was no room for them in the inn.

02:08.text: And there were in the same country shepherds abiding in the field, keeping watch over their flock by night.

02:09.text: And, lo, the angel of the Lord came upon them, and the glory of the Lord shone round about them: and they were sore afraid.

02:10.text: And the angel said unto them, Fear not: for, behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy, which shall be to all people.

02:11.text: For unto you is born this day in the city of David a Saviour, which is Christ the Lord.

02:12.text: And this shall be a sign unto you; Ye shall find the babe wrapped in swaddling clothes, lying in a manger.

02:13.text: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God, and saying,

02:14.text: Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace, good will toward men.

02:15.text: And it came to pass, as the angels were gone away from them into heaven, the shepherds said one to another, Let us now go even unto Bethlehem, and see this thing which is come to pass, which the Lord hath made known unto us.

02:16.text: And they came with haste, and found Mary, and Joseph, and the babe lying in a manger.

02:17.text: And when they had seen it, they made known abroad the saying which was told them concerning this child.

02:18.text: And all they that heard it wondered at those things which were told them by the shepherds.

02:19.text: But Mary kept all these things, and pondered them in her heart.

02:20.text: And the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, as it was told unto them.

02:21.text: And when eight days were accomplished for the circumcising of the child, his name was called JESUS, which was so named of the angel before he was conceived in the womb.

02:22.text: And when the days of her purification according to the law of Moses were accomplished, they brought him to Jerusalem, to present him to the Lord;

02:23.text: (As it is written in the law of the LORD, Every male that openeth the womb shall be called holy to the Lord;)

02:24.text: And to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord, A pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons.

02:25.text: And, behold, there was a man in Jerusalem, whose name was Simeon; and the same man was just and devout, waiting for the consolation of Israel: and the Holy Ghost was upon him.

02:26.text: And it was revealed unto him by the Holy Ghost, that he should not see death, before he had seen the Lord's Christ.

02:27.text: And he came by the Spirit into the temple: and when the parents brought in the child Jesus, to do for him after the custom of the law,

02:28.text: Then took he him up in his arms, and blessed God, and said,

02:29.text: Lord, now lettest thou thy servant depart in peace, according to thy word:

02:30.text: For mine eyes have seen thy salvation,

02:31.text: Which thou hast prepared before the face of all people;

02:32.text: A light to lighten the Gentiles, and the glory of thy people Israel.

02:33.text: And Joseph and his mother marvelled at those things which were spoken of him.

02:34.text: And Simeon blessed them, and said unto Mary his mother, Behold, this child is set for the fall and rising again of many in Israel; and for a sign which shall be spoken against;

02:35.text: (Yea, a sword shall pierce through thy own soul also,) that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed.

02:36.text: And there was one Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Aser: she was of a great age, and had lived with an husband seven years from her virginity;

02:37.text: And she was a widow of about fourscore and four years, which departed not from the temple, but served God with fastings and prayers night and day.

02:38.text: And she coming in that instant gave thanks likewise unto the Lord, and spake of him to all them that looked for redemption in Jerusalem.

02:39.text: And when they had performed all things according to the law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee, to their own city Nazareth.

02:40.text: And the child grew, and waxed strong in spirit, filled with wisdom: and the grace of God was upon him.

02:41.text: Now his parents went to Jerusalem every year at the feast of the passover.

02:42.text: And when he was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem after the custom of the feast.

02:43.text: And when they had fulfilled the days, as they returned, the child Jesus tarried behind in Jerusalem; and Joseph and his mother knew not of it.

02:44.text: But they, supposing him to have been in the company, went a day's journey; and they sought him among their kinsfolk and acquaintance.

02:45.text: And when they found him not, they turned back again to Jerusalem, seeking him.

02:46.text: And it came to pass, that after three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the doctors, both hearing them, and asking them questions.

02:47.text: And all that heard him were astonished at his understanding and answers.

02:48.text: And when they saw him, they were amazed: and his mother said unto him, Son, why hast thou thus dealt with us? behold, thy father and I have sought thee sorrowing.

02:49.text: And he said unto them, How is it that ye sought me? wist ye not that I must be about my Father's business?

02:50.text: And they understood not the saying which he spake unto them.

02:51.text: And he went down with them, and came to Nazareth, and was subject unto them: but his mother kept all these sayings in her heart.

02:52.text: And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favour with God and man.

02:53.text: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judaea, and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip tetrarch of Ituraea and of the region of Trachonitis, and Lysanias the tetrarch of Abilene,

02:54.text: Annas and Caiaphas being the high priests, the word of God came unto John the son of Zacharias in the wilderness.

02:55.text: And he came into all the country about Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins;

02:56.text: As it is written in the book of the words of Esaias the prophet, saying, The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.

02:57.text: Every valley shall be filled, and every mountain and hill shall be brought low; and the crooked shall be made straight, and the rough ways shall be made smooth;

02:58.text: And all flesh shall see the salvation of God.

02:59.text: Then said he to the multitude that came forth to be baptized of him, O generation of vipers, who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

03:00.text: Mark Chapter 3 - Jesus Calls the Twelve Apostles

03:01.text: And he entered again into the synagogue; and there was a man there which had a withered hand.

03:02.text: And they watched him, whether he would heal him on the sabbath day; that they might accuse him.

03:03.text: And he saith unto the man which had the withered hand, Stand forth.

03:04.text: And he saith unto them, Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath days, or to do evil? to save life, or to kill? But they held their peace.

03:05.text: And when he had looked round about on them with anger, being grieved for the hardness of their hearts, he saith unto the man, Stretch forth thine hand. And he stretched it out: and his hand was restored whole as the other.

03:06.text: And the Pharisees went forth, and straightway took counsel with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.

03:07.text: But Jesus withdrew himself with his disciples to the sea: and a great multitude from Galilee followed him, and from Judaea,

03:08.text: And from Jerusalem, and from Idumaea, and from beyond Jordan; and they about Tyre and Sidon, a great multitude, when they had heard what great things he did, came unto him.

03:09.text: And he spake to his disciples, that a small ship should wait on him because of the multitude, lest they should throng him.

03:10.text: For he had healed many; insomuch that they pressed upon him for to touch him, as many as had plagues.

03:11.text: And unclean spirits, when they saw him, fell down before him, and cried, saying, Thou art the Son of God.

03:12.text: And he straitly charged them that they should not make him known.

03:13.text: And he goeth up into a mountain, and calleth unto him whom he would: and they came unto him.

03:14.text: And he ordained twelve, that they should be with him, and that he might send them forth to preach,

03:15.text: And to have power to heal sicknesses, and to cast out devils:

03:17.text: And James the son of Zebedee, and John the brother of James; and he surnamed them Boanerges, which is, The sons of thunder:

03:18.text: And Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus, and Simon the Canaanite,

03:19.text: And Judas Iscariot, which also betrayed him: and they went into an house.

03:20.text: And the multitude cometh together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.

03:21.text: And when his friends heard of it, they went out to lay hold on him: for they said, He is beside himself.

03:22.text: And the scribes which came down from Jerusalem said, He hath Beelzebub, and by the prince of the devils casteth he out devils.

03:23.text: And he called them unto him, and said unto them in parables, How can Satan cast out Satan?

03:24.text: And if a kingdom be divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.

03:25.text: And if a house be divided against itself, that house cannot stand.

03:26.text: And if Satan rise up against himself, and be divided, he cannot stand, but hath an end.

03:27.text: No man can enter into a strong man's house, and spoil his goods, except he will first bind the strong man; and then he will spoil his house.

03:28.text: Verily I say unto you, All sins shall be forgiven unto the sons of men, and blasphemies wherewith soever they shall blaspheme:

03:29.text: But he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost hath never forgiveness, but is in danger of eternal damnation:

03:30.text: Because they said, He hath an unclean spirit.

03:31.text: There came then his brethren and his mother, and, standing without, sent unto him, calling him.

03:32.text: And the multitude sat about him, and they said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee.

03:33.text: And he answered them, saying, Who is my mother, or my brethren?

03:34.text: And he looked round about on them which sat about him, and said, Behold my mother and my brethren!

03:35.text: For whosoever shall do the will of God, the same is my brother, and my sister, and mother.

03:36.text: And he began again to teach by the sea side: and there was gathered unto him a great multitude, so that he entered into a ship, and sat in the sea; and the whole multitude was by the sea on the land.

03:37.text: And he taught them many things by parables, and said unto them in his doctrine,

03:38.text: Hearken; Behold, there went out a sower to sow:

03:39.text: And it came to pass, as he sowed, some fell by the way side, and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up.

03:40.text: And some fell on stony ground, where it had not much earth; and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of earth:

03:41.text: But when the sun was up, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.

03:42.text: And some fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.

03:43.text: And other fell on good ground, and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased; and brought forth, some thirty, and some sixty, and some an hundred.

03:44.text: And he said unto them, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

03:45.text: And when he was alone, they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parable.

03:46.text: And he said unto them, Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God: but unto them that are without, all these things are done in parables:

03:47.text: That seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest at any time they should be converted, and their sins should be forgiven them.

03:48.text: And he said unto them, Know ye not this parable? and how then will ye know all parables?

03:50.text: And these are they by the way side, where the word is sown; but when they have heard, Satan cometh immediately, and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts.

03:51.text: And these are they likewise which are sown on stony ground; who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with gladness;

03:52.text: And have no root in themselves, and so endure but for a time: afterward, when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word's sake, immediately they are offended.

03:53.text: And these are they which are sown among thorns; such as hear the word,

03:54.text: And the cares of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in, choke the word, and it becometh unfruitful.

03:55.text: And these are they which are sown on good ground; such as hear the word, and receive it, and bring forth fruit, some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some an hundred.

03:56.text: And he said unto them, Is a candle brought to be put under a bushel, or under a bed? and not to be set on a candlestick?

03:57.text: For there is nothing hid, which shall not be manifested; neither was any thing kept secret, but that it should come abroad.

03:58.text: If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.

03:59.text: And he said unto them, Take heed what ye hear: with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you: and unto you that hear shall more be given.

04:00.text: John Chapter 4 - Jesus and the Samaritan Woman

04:01.text: When therefore the LORD knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John,

04:02.text: (Though Jesus himself baptized not, but his disciples,)

04:03.text: He left Judaea, and departed again into Galilee.

04:04.text: And he must needs go through Samaria.

04:05.text: Then cometh he to a city of Samaria, which is called Sychar, near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.

04:06.text: Now Jacob's well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied with his journey, sat thus on the well: and it was about the sixth hour.

04:07.text: There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water: Jesus saith unto her, Give me to drink.

04:08.text: (For his disciples were gone away unto the city to buy meat.)

04:09.text: Then saith the woman of Samaria unto him, How is it that thou, being a Jew, askest drink of me, which am a woman of Samaria? for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans.

04:10.text: Jesus answered and said unto her, If thou knewest the gift of God, and who it is that saith to thee, Give me to drink; thou wouldest have asked of him, and he would have given thee living water.

04:11.text: The woman saith unto him, Sir, thou hast nothing to draw with, and the well is deep: from whence then hast thou that living water?

04:12.text: Art thou greater than our father Jacob, which gave us the well, and drank thereof himself, and his children, and his cattle?

04:13.text: Jesus answered and said unto her, Whosoever drinketh of this water shall thirst again:

04:14.text: But whosoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst; but the water that I shall give him shall be in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life.

04:15.text: The woman saith unto him, Sir, give me this water, that I thirst not, neither come hither to draw.

04:16.text: Jesus saith unto her, Go, call thy husband, and come hither.

04:17.text: The woman answered and said, I have no husband. Jesus said unto her, Thou hast well said, I have no husband:

04:18.text: For thou hast had five husbands; and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband: in that saidst thou truly.

04:19.text: The woman saith unto him, Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.

04:20.text: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain; and ye say, that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.

04:21.text: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, believe me, the hour cometh, when ye shall neither in this mountain, nor yet at Jerusalem, worship the Father.

04:22.text: Ye worship ye know not what: we know what we worship: for salvation is of the Jews.

04:23.text: But the hour cometh, and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth: for the Father seeketh such to worship him.

04:24.text: God is a Spirit: and they that worship him must worship him in spirit and in truth.

04:25.text: The woman saith unto him, I know that Messias cometh, which is called Christ: when he is come, he will tell us all things.

04:26.text: Jesus saith unto her, I that speak unto thee am he.

04:27.text: And upon this came his disciples, and marvelled that he talked with the woman: yet no man said, What seekest thou? or, Why talkest thou with her?

04:28.text: The woman then left her waterpot, and went her way into the city, and saith to the men,

04:29.text: Come, see a man, which told me all things that ever I did: is not this the Christ?

04:30.text: Then they went out of the city, and came unto him.

04:31.text: In the mean while his disciples prayed him, saying, Master, eat.

04:32.text: But he said unto them, I have meat to eat that ye know not of.

04:33.text: Therefore said the disciples one to another, Hath any man brought him ought to eat?

04:34.text: Jesus saith unto them, My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, and to finish his work.

04:35.text: Say not ye, There are yet four months, and then cometh harvest? behold, I say unto you, Lift up your eyes, and look on the fields; for they are white already to harvest.

04:36.text: And he that reapeth receiveth wages, and gathereth fruit unto life eternal: that both he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice together.

04:37.text: And herein is that saying true, One soweth, and another reapeth.

04:38.text: I sent you to reap that whereon ye bestowed no labour: other men laboured, and ye are entered into their labours.

04:39.text: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him for the saying of the woman, which testified, He told me all that ever I did.

04:40.text: So when the Samaritans were come unto him, they besought him that he would tarry with them: and he abode there two days.

04:41.text: And many more believed because of his own word;

04:42.text: And said unto the woman, Now we believe, not because of thy saying: for we have heard him ourselves, and know that this is indeed the Christ, the Saviour of the world.

04:43.text: Now after two days he departed thence, and went into Galilee.

04:44.text: For Jesus himself testified, that a prophet hath no honour in his own country.

04:45.text: Then when he was come into Galilee, the Galilaeans received him, having seen all the things that he did at Jerusalem at the feast: for they also went unto the feast.

04:46.text: So Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine. And there was a certain nobleman, whose son was sick at Capernaum.

04:47.text: When he heard that Jesus was come out of Judaea into Galilee, he went unto him, and besought him that he would come down, and heal his son: for he was at the point of death.

04:48.text: Then said Jesus unto him, Except ye see signs and wonders, ye will not believe.

04:49.text: The nobleman saith unto him, Sir, come down ere my child die.

04:50.text: Jesus saith unto him, Go thy way; thy son liveth. And the man believed the word that Jesus had spoken unto him, and he went his way.

04:51.text: And as he was now going down, his servants met him, and told him, saying, Thy son liveth.

04:52.text: Then enquired he of them the hour when he began to amend. And they said unto him, Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.

04:53.text: So the father knew that it was at the same hour, in the which Jesus said unto him, Thy son liveth: and himself believed, and his whole house.

04:54.text: This is again the second miracle that Jesus did, when he was come out of Judaea into Galilee.

04:55.text: After this there was a feast of the Jews; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

04:56.text: Now there is at Jerusalem by the sheep market a pool, which is called in the Hebrew tongue Bethesda, having five porches.

04:57.text: In these lay a great multitude of impotent folk, of blind, halt, withered, waiting for the moving of the water.

04:58.text: For an angel went down at a certain season into the pool, and troubled the water: whosoever then first after the troubling of the water stepped in was made whole of whatsoever disease he had.

04:59.text: And a certain man was there, which had an infirmity thirty and eight years.

05:00.text: Matthew Chapter 5 - The Sermon on the Mount

05:01.text: And seeing the multitudes, he went up into a mountain: and when he was set, his disciples came unto him:

05:02.text: And he opened his mouth, and taught them, saying,

05:03.text: Blessed are the poor in spirit: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

05:04.text: Blessed are they that mourn: for they shall be comforted.

05:05.text: Blessed are the meek: for they shall inherit the earth.

05:06.text: Blessed are they which do hunger and thirst after righteousness: for they shall be filled.

05:07.text: Blessed are the merciful: for they shall obtain mercy.

05:08.text: Blessed are the pure in heart: for they shall see God.

05:09.text: Blessed are the peacemakers: for they shall be called the children of God.

05:10.text: Blessed are they which are persecuted for righteousness' sake: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

05:11.text: Blessed are ye, when men shall revile you, and persecute you, and shall say all manner of evil against you falsely, for my sake.

05:12.text: Rejoice, and be exceeding glad: for great is your reward in heaven: for so persecuted they the prophets which were before you.

05:13.text: Ye are the salt of the earth: but if the salt have lost his savour, wherewith shall it be salted? it is thenceforth good for nothing, but to be cast out, and to be trodden under foot of men.

05:14.text: Ye are the light of the world. A city that is set on an hill cannot be hid.

05:15.text: Neither do men light a candle, and put it under a bushel, but on a candlestick; and it giveth light unto all that are in the house.

05:16.text: Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father which is in heaven.

05:17.text: Think not that I am come to destroy the law, or the prophets: I am not come to destroy, but to fulfil.

05:18.text: For verily I say unto you, Till heaven and earth pass, one jot or one tittle shall in no wise pass from the law, till all be fulfilled.

05:19.text: Whosoever therefore shall break one of these least commandments, and shall teach men so, he shall be called the least in the kingdom of heaven: but whosoever shall do and teach them, the same shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven.

05:20.text: For I say unto you, That except your righteousness shall exceed the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees, ye shall in no case enter into the kingdom of heaven.

05:21.text: Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time, Thou shalt not kill; and whosoever shall kill shall be in danger of the judgment:

05:22.text: But I say unto you, That whosoever is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment: and whosoever shall say to his brother, Raca, shall be in danger of the council: but whosoever shall say, Thou fool, shall be in danger of hell fire.

05:23.text: Therefore if thou bring thy gift to the altar, and there rememberest that thy brother hath ought against thee;

05:24.text: Leave there thy gift before the altar, and go thy way; first be reconciled to thy brother, and then come and offer thy gift.

05:25.text: Agree with thine adversary quickly, whiles thou art in the way with him; lest at any time the adversary deliver thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and thou be cast into prison.

05:26.text: Verily I say unto thee, Thou shalt by no means come out thence, till thou hast paid the uttermost farthing.

05:27.text: Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time, Thou shalt not commit adultery:

05:28.text: But I say unto you, That whosoever looketh on a woman to lust after her hath committed adultery with her already in his heart.

05:29.text: And if thy right eye offend thee, pluck it out, and cast it from thee: for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish, and not that thy whole body should be cast into hell.

05:30.text: And if thy right hand offend thee, cut it off, and cast it from thee: for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish, and not that thy whole body should be cast into hell.

05:31.text: It hath been said, Whosoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of divorcement:

05:32.text: But I say unto you, That whosoever shall put away his wife, saving for the cause of fornication, causeth her to commit adultery: and whosoever shall marry her that is divorced committeth adultery.

05:33.text: Again, ye have heard that it hath been said by them of old time, Thou shalt not forswear thyself, but shalt perform unto the Lord thine oaths:

05:34.text: But I say unto you, Swear not at all; neither by heaven; for it is God's throne:

05:35.text: Nor by the earth; for it is his footstool: neither by Jerusalem; for it is the city of the great King.

05:36.text: Neither shalt thou swear by thy head, because thou canst not make one hair white or black.

05:37.text: But let your communication be, Yea, yea; Nay, nay: for whatsoever is more than these cometh of evil.

05:38.text: Ye have heard that it hath been said, An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth:

05:39.text: But I say unto you, That ye resist not evil: but whosoever shall smite thee on thy right cheek, turn to him the other also.

05:40.text: And if any man will sue thee at the law, and take away thy coat, let him have thy cloke also.

05:41.text: And whosoever shall compel thee to go a mile, go with him twain.

05:42.text: Give to him that asketh thee, and from him that would borrow of thee turn not thou away.

05:43.text: Ye have heard that it hath been said, Thou shalt love thy neighbour, and hate thine enemy.

05:44.text: But I say unto you, Love your enemies, bless them that curse you, do good to them that hate you, and pray for them which despitefully use you, and persecute you;

05:45.text: That ye may be the children of your Father which is in heaven: for he maketh his sun to rise on the evil and on the good, and sendeth rain on the just and on the unjust.

05:46.text: For if ye love them which love you, what reward have ye? do not even the publicans the same?

05:47.text: And if ye salute your brethren only, what do ye more than others? do not even the publicans so?

05:48.text: Be ye therefore perfect, even as your Father which is in heaven is perfect.

05:49.text: Take heed that ye do not your alms before men, to be seen of them: otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.

05:50.text: Therefore when thou doest thine alms, do not sound a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

05:51.text: But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth:

05:52.text: That thine alms may be in secret: and thy Father which seeth in secret himself shall reward thee openly.

05:53.text: And when thou prayest, thou shalt not be as the hypocrites are: for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

05:54.text: But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast shut thy door, pray to thy Father which is in secret; and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly.

05:55.text: But when ye pray, use not vain repetitions, as the heathen do: for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.

05:56.text: Be not ye therefore like unto them: for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of, before ye ask him.

05:57.text: After this manner therefore pray ye: Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name.

05:58.text: Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven.

05:59.text: Give us this day our daily bread.

06:00.text: Luke Chapter 6 - The Sermon on the Plain

06:01.text: And it came to pass on the second sabbath after the first, that he went through the corn fields; and his disciples plucked the ears of corn, and did eat, rubbing them in their hands.

06:02.text: And certain of the Pharisees said unto them, Why do ye that which is not lawful to do on the sabbath days?

06:03.text: And Jesus answering them said, Have ye not read so much as this, what David did, when himself was an hungred, and they which were with him;

06:04.text: How he went into the house of God, and did take and eat the shewbread, and gave also to them that were with him; which it is not lawful to eat but for the priests alone?

06:05.text: And he said unto them, That the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.

06:06.text: And it came to pass also on another sabbath, that he entered into the synagogue and taught: and there was a man whose right hand was withered.

06:07.text: And the scribes and Pharisees watched him, whether he would heal on the sabbath day; that they might find an accusation against him.

06:08.text: But he knew their thoughts, and said to the man which had the withered hand, Rise up, and stand forth in the midst. And he arose and stood forth.

06:09.text: Then said Jesus unto them, I will ask you one thing; Is it lawful on the sabbath days to do good, or to do evil? to save life, or to destroy it?

06:10.text: And looking round about upon them all, he said unto the man, Stretch forth thy hand. And he did so: and his hand was restored whole as the other.

06:11.text: And they were filled with madness; and communed one with another what they might do to Jesus.

06:12.text: And it came to pass in those days, that he went out into a mountain to pray, and continued all night in prayer to God.

06:13.text: And when it was day, he called unto him his disciples: and of them he chose twelve, whom also he named apostles;

06:14.text: Simon, (whom he also named Peter,) and Andrew his brother, James and John, Philip and Bartholomew,

06:15.text: Matthew and Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon called Zelotes,

06:16.text: And Judas the brother of James, and Judas Iscariot, which also was the traitor.

06:17.text: And he came down with them, and stood in the plain, and the company of his disciples, and a great multitude of people out of all Judaea and Jerusalem, and from the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, which came to hear him, and to be healed of their diseases;

06:18.text: And they that were vexed with unclean spirits: and they were healed.

06:19.text: And the whole multitude sought to touch him: for there went virtue out of him, and healed them all.

06:20.text: And he lifted up his eyes on his disciples, and said, Blessed be ye poor: for yours is the kingdom of God.

06:21.text: Blessed are ye that hunger now: for ye shall be filled. Blessed are ye that weep now: for ye shall laugh.

06:22.text: Blessed are ye, when men shall hate you, and when they shall separate you from their company, and shall reproach you, and cast out your name as evil, for the Son of man's sake.

06:23.text: Rejoice ye in that day, and leap for joy: for, behold, your reward is great in heaven: for in the like manner did their fathers unto the prophets.

06:24.text: But woe unto you that are rich! for ye have received your consolation.

06:25.text: Woe unto you that are full! for ye shall hunger. Woe unto you that laugh now! for ye shall mourn and weep.

06:26.text: Woe unto you, when all men shall speak well of you! for so did their fathers to the false prophets.

06:27.text: But I say unto you which hear, Love your enemies, do good to them which hate you,

06:28.text: Bless them that curse you, and pray for them which despitefully use you.

06:29.text: And unto him that smiteth thee on the one cheek offer also the other; and him that taketh away thy cloke forbid not to take thy coat also.

06:30.text: Give to every man that asketh of thee; and of him that taketh away thy goods ask them not again.

06:31.text: And as ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them likewise.

06:32.text: For if ye love them which love you, what thank have ye? for sinners also love those that love them.

06:33.text: And if ye do good to them which do good to you, what thank have ye? for sinners also do even the same.

06:34.text: And if ye lend to them of whom ye hope to receive, what thank have ye? for sinners also lend to sinners, to receive as much again.

06:35.text: But love ye your enemies, and do good, and lend, hoping for nothing again; and your reward shall be great, and ye shall be the children of the Highest: for he is kind unto the unthankful and to the evil.

06:36.text: Be ye therefore merciful, as your Father also is merciful.

06:37.text: Judge not, and ye shall not be judged: condemn not, and ye shall not be condemned: forgive, and ye shall be forgiven:

06:38.text: Give, and it shall be given unto you; good measure, pressed down, and shaken together, and running over, shall men give into your bosom. For with the same measure that ye mete withal it shall be measured to you again.

06:39.text: And he spake a parable unto them, Can the blind lead the blind? shall they not both fall into the ditch?

06:40.text: The disciple is not above his master: but every one that is perfect shall be as his master.

06:41.text: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother's eye, but perceivest not the beam that is in thine own eye?

06:42.text: Either how canst thou say to thy brother, Brother, let me pull out the mote that is in thine eye, when thou thyself beholdest not the beam that is in thine own eye? Thou hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine own eye, and then shalt thou see clearly to pull out the mote that is in thy brother's eye.

06:43.text: For a good tree bringeth not forth corrupt fruit; neither doth a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.

06:44.text: For every tree is known by his own fruit. For of thorns men do not gather figs, nor of a bramble bush gather they grapes.

06:45.text: A good man out of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is good; and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is evil: for of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaketh.

06:46.text: And why call ye me, Lord, Lord, and do not the things which I say?

06:47.text: Whosoever cometh to me, and heareth my sayings, and doeth them, I will shew you to whom he is like:

06:48.text: He is like a man which built an house, and digged deep, and laid the foundation on a rock: and when the flood arose, the stream beat vehemently upon that house, and could not shake it: for it was founded upon a rock.

06:49.text: But he that heareth, and doeth not, is like a man that without a foundation built an house upon the earth; against which the stream did beat vehemently, and immediately it fell; and the ruin of that house was great.

06:50.text: Now when he had ended all his sayings in the audience of the people, he entered into Capernaum.

06:51.text: And a certain centurion's servant, who was dear unto him, was sick, and ready to die.

06:52.text: And when he heard of Jesus, he sent unto him the elders of the Jews, beseeching him that he would come and heal his servant.

06:53.text: And when they came to Jesus, they besought him instantly, saying, That he was worthy for whom he should do this:

06:54.text: For he loveth our nation, and he hath built us a synagogue.

06:55.text: Then Jesus went with them. And when he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying unto him, Lord, trouble not thyself: for I am not worthy that thou shouldest enter under my roof:

06:56.text: Wherefore neither thought I myself worthy to come unto thee: but say in a word, and my servant shall be healed.

06:57.text: For I also am a man set under authority, having under me soldiers, and I say unto one, Go, and he goeth; and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth it.

06:58.text: When Jesus heard these things, he marvelled at him, and turned him about, and said unto the people that followed him, I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, no, not in Israel.

06:59.text: And they that were sent, returning to the house, found the servant whole that had been sick.

07:00.text: Mark Chapter 7 - Traditions and True Defilement

07:01.text: Then came together unto him the Pharisees, and certain of the scribes, which came from Jerusalem.

07:02.text: And when they saw some of his disciples eat bread with defiled, that is to say, with unwashen, hands, they found fault.

07:03.text: For the Pharisees, and all the Jews, except they wash their hands oft, eat not, holding the tradition of the elders.

07:04.text: And when they come from the market, except they wash, they eat not. And many other things there be, which they have received to hold, as the washing of cups, and pots, brasen vessels, and of tables.

07:05.text: Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him, Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashen hands?

07:06.text: He answered and said unto them, Well hath Esaias prophesied of you hypocrites, as it is written, This people honoureth me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.

07:07.text: Howbeit in vain do they worship me, teaching for doctrines the commandments of men.

07:08.text: For laying aside the commandment of God, ye hold the tradition of men, as the washing of pots and cups: and many other such like things ye do.

07:09.text: And he said unto them, Full well ye reject the commandment of God, that ye may keep your own tradition.

07:10.text: For Moses said, Honour thy father and thy mother; and, Whoso curseth father or mother, let him die the death:

07:11.text: But ye say, If a man shall say to his father or mother, It is Corban, that is to say, a gift, by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me; he shall be free.

07:12.text: And ye suffer him no more to do ought for his father or his mother;

07:13.text: Making the word of God of none effect through your tradition, which ye have delivered: and many such like things do ye.

07:14.text: And when he had called all the people unto him, he said unto them, Hearken unto me every one of you, and understand:

07:15.text: There is nothing from without a man, that entering into him can defile him: but the things which come out of him, those are they that defile the man.

07:16.text: If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.

07:17.text: And when he was entered into the house from the people, his disciples asked him concerning the parable.

07:18.text: And he saith unto them, Are ye so without understanding also? Do ye not perceive, that whatsoever thing from without entereth into the man, it cannot defile him;

07:19.text: Because it entereth not into his heart, but into the belly, and goeth out into the draught, purging all meats?

07:20.text: And he said, That which cometh out of the man, that defileth the man.

07:21.text: For from within, out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, fornications, murders,

07:22.text: Thefts, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, lasciviousness, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, foolishness:

07:23.text: All these evil things come from within, and defile the man.

07:24.text: And from thence he arose, and went into the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and entered into an house, and would have no man know it: but he could not be hid.

07:25.text: For a certain woman, whose young daughter had an unclean spirit, heard of him, and came and fell at his feet:

07:26.text: The woman was a Greek, a Syrophenician by nation; and she besought him that he would cast forth the devil out of her daughter.

07:27.text: But Jesus said unto her, Let the children first be filled: for it is not meet to take the children's bread, and to cast it unto the dogs.

07:28.text: And she answered and said unto him, Yes, Lord: yet the dogs under the table eat of the children's crumbs.

07:29.text: And he said unto her, For this saying go thy way; the devil is gone out of thy daughter.

07:30.text: And when she was come to her house, she found the devil gone out, and her daughter laid upon the bed.

07:31.text: And again, departing from the coasts of Tyre and Sidon, he came unto the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the coasts of Decapolis.

07:32.text: And they bring unto him one that was deaf, and had an impediment in his speech; and they beseech him to put his hand upon him.

07:33.text: And he took him aside from the multitude, and put his fingers into his ears, and he spit, and touched his tongue;

07:34.text: And looking up to heaven, he sighed, and saith unto him, Ephphatha, that is, Be opened.

07:35.text: And straightway his ears were opened, and the string of his tongue was loosed, and he spake plain.

07:36.text: And he charged them that they should tell no man: but the more he charged them, so much the more a great deal they published it;

07:37.text: And were beyond measure astonished, saying, He hath done all things well: he maketh both the deaf to hear, and the dumb to speak.

07:38.text: In those days the multitude being very great, and having nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples unto him, and saith unto them,

07:39.text: I have compassion on the multitude, because they have now been with me three days, and have nothing to eat:

07:40.text: And if I send them away fasting to their own houses, they will faint by the way: for divers of them came from far.

07:41.text: And his disciples answered him, From whence can a man satisfy these men with bread here in the wilderness?

07:42.text: And he asked them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven.

07:43.text: And he commanded the people to sit down on the ground: and he took the seven loaves, and gave thanks, and brake, and gave to his disciples to set before them; and they did set them before the people.

07:44.text: And they had a few small fishes: and he blessed, and commanded to set them also before them.

07:45.text: So they did eat, and were filled: and they took up of the broken meat that was left seven baskets.

07:46.text: And they that had eaten were about four thousand: and he sent them away.

07:47.text: And straightway he entered into a ship with his disciples, and came into the parts of Dalmanutha.

07:48.text: And the Pharisees came forth, and began to question with him, seeking of him a sign from heaven, tempting him.

07:49.text: And he sighed deeply in his spirit, and saith, Why doth this generation seek after a sign? verily I say unto you, There shall no sign be given unto this generation.

07:50.text: And he left them, and entering into the ship again departed to the other side.

07:51.text: Now the disciples had forgotten to take bread, neither had they in the ship with them more than one loaf.

07:52.text: And he charged them, saying, Take heed, beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, and of the leaven of Herod.

07:53.text: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, It is because we have no bread.

07:54.text: And when Jesus knew it, he saith unto them, Why reason ye, because ye have no bread? perceive ye not yet, neither understand? have ye your heart yet hardened?

07:55.text: Having eyes, see ye not? and having ears, hear ye not? and do ye not remember?

07:56.text: When I brake the five loaves among five thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up? They say unto him, Twelve.

07:57.text: And when the seven among four thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up? And they said, Seven.

07:58.text: And he said unto them, How is it that ye do not understand?

07:59.text: And he cometh to Bethsaida; and they bring a blind man unto him, and besought him to touch him.

08:00.text: John Chapter 8 - The Woman Caught in Adultery

08:01.text: Jesus went unto the mount of Olives.

08:02.text: And early in the morning he came again into the temple, and all the people came unto him; and he sat down, and taught them.

08:03.text: And the scribes and Pharisees brought unto him a woman taken in adultery; and when they had set her in the midst,

08:04.text: They say unto him, Master, this woman was taken in adultery, in the very act.

08:05.text: Now Moses in the law commanded us, that such should be stoned: but what sayest thou?

08:06.text: This they said, tempting him, that they might have to accuse him. But Jesus stooped down, and with his finger wrote on the ground, as though he heard them not.

08:07.text: So when they continued asking him, he lifted up himself, and said unto them, He that is without sin among you, let him first cast a stone at her.

08:08.text: And again he stooped down, and wrote on the ground.

08:09.text: And they which heard it, being convicted by their own conscience, went out one by one, beginning at the eldest, even unto the last: and Jesus was left alone, and the woman standing in the midst.

08:10.text: When Jesus had lifted up himself, and saw none but the woman, he said unto her, Woman, where are those thine accusers? hath no man condemned thee?

08:11.text: She said, No man, Lord. And Jesus said unto her, Neither do I condemn thee: go, and sin no more.

08:12.text: Then spake Jesus again unto them, saying, I am the light of the world: he that followeth me shall not walk in darkness, but shall have the light of life.

08:13.text: The Pharisees therefore said unto him, Thou bearest record of thyself; thy record is not true.

08:14.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, Though I bear record of myself, yet my record is true: for I know whence I came, and whither I go; but ye cannot tell whence I come, and whither I go.

08:15.text: Ye judge after the flesh; I judge no man.

08:16.text: And yet if I judge, my judgment is true: for I am not alone, but I and the Father that sent me.

08:17.text: It is also written in your law, that the testimony of two men is true.

08:18.text: I am one that bear witness of myself, and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me.

08:19.text: Then said they unto him, Where is thy Father? Jesus answered, Ye neither know me, nor my Father: if ye had known me, ye should have known my Father also.

08:20.text: These words spake Jesus in the treasury, as he taught in the temple: and no man laid hands on him; for his hour was not yet come.

08:21.text: Then said Jesus again unto them, I go my way, and ye shall seek me, and shall die in your sins: whither I go, ye cannot come.

08:22.text: Then said the Jews, Will he kill himself? because he saith, Whither I go, ye cannot come.

08:23.text: And he said unto them, Ye are from beneath; I am from above: ye are of this world; I am not of this world.

08:24.text: I said therefore unto you, that ye shall die in your sins: for if ye believe not that I am he, ye shall die in your sins.

08:25.text: Then said they unto him, Who art thou? And Jesus saith unto them, Even the same that I said unto you from the beginning.

08:26.text: I have many things to say and to judge of you: but he that sent me is true; and I speak to the world those things which I have heard of him.

08:27.text: They understood not that he spake to them of the Father.

08:28.text: Then said Jesus unto them, When ye have lifted up the Son of man, then shall ye know that I am he, and that I do nothing of myself; but as my Father hath taught me, I speak these things.

08:29.text: And he that sent me is with me: the Father hath not left me alone; for I do always those things that please him.

08:30.text: As he spake these words, many believed on him.

08:31.text: Then said Jesus to those Jews which believed on him, If ye continue in my word, then are ye my disciples indeed;

08:32.text: And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.

08:33.text: They answered him, We be Abraham's seed, and were never in bondage to any man: how sayest thou, Ye shall be made free?

08:34.text: Jesus answered them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whosoever committeth sin is the servant of sin.

08:35.text: And the servant abideth not in the house for ever: but the Son abideth ever.

08:36.text: If the Son therefore shall make you free, ye shall be free indeed.

08:37.text: I know that ye are Abraham's seed; but ye seek to kill me, because my word hath no place in you.

08:38.text: I speak that which I have seen with my Father: and ye do that which ye have seen with your father.

08:39.text: They answered and said unto him, Abraham is our father. Jesus saith unto them, If ye were Abraham's children, ye would do the works of Abraham.

08:40.text: But now ye seek to kill me, a man that hath told you the truth, which I have heard of God: this did not Abraham.

08:41.text: Ye do the deeds of your father. Then said they to him, We be not born of fornication; we have one Father, even God.

08:42.text: Jesus said unto them, If God were your Father, ye would love me: for I proceeded forth and came from God; neither came I of myself, but he sent me.

08:43.text: Why do ye not understand my speech? even because ye cannot hear my word.

08:44.text: Ye are of your father the devil, and the lusts of your father ye will do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and abode not in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaketh a lie, he speaketh of his own: for he is a liar, and the father of it.

08:45.text: And because I tell you the truth, ye believe me not.

08:46.text: Which of you convinceth me of sin? And if I say the truth, why do ye not believe me?

08:47.text: He that is of God heareth God's words: ye therefore hear them not, because ye are not of God.

08:48.text: Then answered the Jews, and said unto him, Say we not well that thou art a Samaritan, and hast a devil?

08:49.text: Jesus answered, I have not a devil; but I honour my Father, and ye do dishonour me.

08:50.text: And I seek not mine own glory: there is one that seeketh and judgeth.

08:51.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, If a man keep my saying, he shall never see death.

08:52.text: Then said the Jews unto him, Now we know that thou hast a devil. Abraham is dead, and the prophets; and thou sayest, If a man keep my saying, he shall never taste of death.

08:53.text: Art thou greater than our father Abraham, which is dead? and the prophets are dead: whom makest thou thyself?

08:54.text: Jesus answered, If I honour myself, my honour is nothing: it is my Father that honoureth me; of whom ye say, that he is your God:

08:55.text: Yet ye have not known him; but I know him: and if I should say, I know him not, I shall be a liar like unto you: but I know him, and keep his saying.

08:56.text: Your father Abraham rejoiced to see my day: and he saw it, and was glad.

08:57.text: Then said the Jews unto him, Thou art not yet fifty years old, and hast thou seen Abraham?

08:58.text: Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Before Abraham was, I am.

08:59.text: Then took they up stones to cast at him: but Jesus hid himself, and went out of the temple, going through the midst of them, and so passed by.

09:00.text: Matthew Chapter 9 - Jesus Heals and Calls Disciples

09:01.text: And he entered into a ship, and passed over, and came into his own city.

09:02.text: And, behold, they brought to him a man sick of the palsy, lying on a bed: and Jesus seeing their faith said unto the sick of the palsy; Son, be of good cheer; thy sins be forgiven thee.

09:03.text: And, behold, certain of the scribes said within themselves, This man blasphemeth.

09:04.text: And Jesus knowing their thoughts said, Wherefore think ye evil in your hearts?

09:05.text: For whether is easier, to say, Thy sins be forgiven thee; or to say, Arise, and walk?

09:06.text: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins, (then saith he to the sick of the palsy,) Arise, take up thy bed, and go unto thine house.

09:07.text: And he arose, and departed to his house.

09:08.text: But when the multitudes saw it, they marvelled, and glorified God, which had given such power unto men.

09:09.text: And as Jesus passed forth from thence, he saw a man, named Matthew, sitting at the receipt of custom: and he saith unto him, Follow me. And he arose, and followed him.

09:10.text: And it came to pass, as Jesus sat at meat in the house, behold, many publicans and sinners came and sat down with him and his disciples.

09:11.text: And when the Pharisees saw it, they said unto his disciples, Why eateth your Master with publicans and sinners?

09:12.text: But when Jesus heard that, he said unto them, They that be whole need not a physician, but they that are sick.

09:13.text: But go ye and learn what that meaneth, I will have mercy, and not sacrifice: for I am not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.

09:14.text: Then came to him the disciples of John, saying, Why do we and the Pharisees fast oft, but thy disciples fast not?

09:15.text: And Jesus said unto them, Can the children of the bridechamber mourn, as long as the bridegroom is with them? but the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken from them, and then shall they fast.

09:16.text: No man putteth a piece of new cloth unto an old garment, for that which is put in to fill it up taketh from the garment, and the rent is made worse.

09:17.text: Neither do men put new wine into old bottles: else the bottles break, and the wine runneth out, and the bottles perish: but they put new wine into new bottles, and both are preserved.

09:18.text: While he spake these things unto them, behold, there came a certain ruler, and worshipped him, saying, My daughter is even now dead: but come and lay thy hand upon her, and she shall live.

09:19.text: And Jesus arose, and followed him, and so did his disciples.

09:20.text: And, behold, a woman, which was diseased with an issue of blood twelve years, came behind him, and touched the hem of his garment:

09:21.text: For she said within herself, If I may but touch his garment, I shall be whole.

09:22.text: But Jesus turned him about, and when he saw her, he said, Daughter, be of good comfort; thy faith hath made thee whole. And the woman was made whole from that hour.

09:23.text: And when Jesus came into the ruler's house, and saw the minstrels and the people making a noise,

09:24.text: He said unto them, Give place: for the maid is not dead, but sleepeth. And they laughed him to scorn.

09:25.text: But when the people were put forth, he went in, and took her by the hand, and the maid arose.

09:26.text: And the fame hereof went abroad into all that land.

09:27.text: And when Jesus departed thence, two blind men followed him, crying, and saying, Thou son of David, have mercy on us.

09:28.text: And when he was come into the house, the blind men came to him: and Jesus saith unto them, Believe ye that I am able to do this? They said unto him, Yea, Lord.

09:29.text: Then touched he their eyes, saying, According to your faith be it unto you.

09:30.text: And their eyes were opened; and Jesus straitly charged them, saying, See that no man know it.

09:31.text: But they, when they were departed, spread abroad his fame in all that country.

09:32.text: As they went out, behold, they brought to him a dumb man possessed with a devil.

09:33.text: And when the devil was cast out, the dumb spake: and the multitudes marvelled, saying, It was never so seen in Israel.

09:34.text: But the Pharisees said, He casteth out devils through the prince of the devils.

09:35.text: And Jesus went about all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every sickness and every disease among the people.

09:36.text: But when he saw the multitudes, he was moved with compassion on them, because they fainted, and were scattered abroad, as sheep having no shepherd.

09:37.text: Then saith he unto his disciples, The harvest truly is plenteous, but the labourers are few;

09:38.text: Pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he will send forth labourers into his harvest.

09:39.text: And when he had called unto him his twelve disciples, he gave them power against unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal all manner of sickness and all manner of disease.

09:40.text: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these; The first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother; James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother;

09:41.text: Philip, and Bartholomew; Thomas, and Matthew the publican; James the son of Alphaeus, and Lebbaeus, whose surname was Thaddaeus;

09:42.text: Simon the Canaanite, and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.

09:43.text: These twelve Jesus sent forth, and commanded them, saying, Go not into the way of the Gentiles, and into any city of the Samaritans enter ye not:

09:44.text: But go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

09:45.text: And as ye go, preach, saying, The kingdom of heaven is at hand.

09:46.text: Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, raise the dead, cast out devils: freely ye have received, freely give.

09:47.text: Provide neither gold, nor silver, nor brass in your purses,

09:48.text: Nor scrip for your journey, neither two coats, neither shoes, nor yet staves: for the workman is worthy of his meat.

09:49.text: And into whatsoever city or town ye shall enter, enquire who in it is worthy; and there abide till ye go thence.

09:50.text: And when ye come into an house, salute it.

09:51.text: And if the house be worthy, let your peace come upon it: but if it be not worthy, let your peace return to you.

09:52.text: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear your words, when ye depart out of that house or city, shake off the dust of your feet.

09:53.text: Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.

09:54.text: Behold, I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves: be ye therefore wise as serpents, and harmless as doves.

09:55.text: But beware of men: for they will deliver you up to the councils, and they will scourge you in their synagogues;

09:56.text: And ye shall be brought before governors and kings for my sake, for a testimony against them and the Gentiles.

09:57.text: But when they deliver you up, take no thought how or what ye shall speak: for it shall be given you in that same hour what ye shall speak.

09:58.text: For it is not ye that speak, but the Spirit of your Father which speaketh in you.

09:59.text: And the brother shall deliver up the brother to death, and the father the child: and the children shall rise up against their parents, and cause them to be put to death.

10:00.text: Luke Chapter 10 - The Sending of the Seventy-Two

10:01.text: After these things the Lord appointed other seventy also, and sent them two and two before his face into every city and place, whither he himself would come.

10:02.text: Therefore said he unto them, The harvest truly is great, but the labourers are few: pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he would send forth labourers into his harvest.

10:03.text: Go your ways: behold, I send you forth as lambs among wolves.

10:04.text: Carry neither purse, nor scrip, nor shoes: and salute no man by the way.

10:05.text: And into whatsoever house ye enter, first say, Peace be to this house.

10:06.text: And if the son of peace be there, your peace shall rest upon it: if not, it shall turn to you again.

10:07.text: And in the same house remain, eating and drinking such things as they give: for the labourer is worthy of his hire. Go not from house to house.

10:08.text: And into whatsoever city ye enter, and they receive you, eat such things as are set before you:

10:09.text: And heal the sick that are therein, and say unto them, The kingdom of God is come nigh unto you.

10:10.text: But into whatsoever city ye enter, and they receive you not, go your ways out into the streets of the same, and say,

10:11.text: Even the very dust of your city, which cleaveth on us, we do wipe off against you: notwithstanding be ye sure of this, that the kingdom of God is come nigh unto you.

10:12.text: But I say unto you, that it shall be more tolerable in that day for Sodom, than for that city.

10:13.text: Woe unto thee, Chorazin! woe unto thee, Bethsaida! for if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon, which have been done in you, they had a great while ago repented, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.

10:14.text: But it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment, than for you.

10:15.text: And thou, Capernaum, which art exalted to heaven, shalt be thrust down to hell.

10:16.text: He that heareth you heareth me; and he that despiseth you despiseth me; and he that despiseth me despiseth him that sent me.

10:17.text: And the seventy returned again with joy, saying, Lord, even the devils are subject unto us through thy name.

10:18.text: And he said unto them, I beheld Satan as lightning fall from heaven.

10:19.text: Behold, I give unto you power to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy: and nothing shall by any means hurt you.

10:20.text: Notwithstanding in this rejoice not, that the spirits are subject unto you; but rather rejoice, because your names are written in heaven.

10:21.text: In that hour Jesus rejoiced in spirit, and said, I thank thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent, and hast revealed them unto babes: even so, Father; for so it seemed good in thy sight.

10:22.text: All things are delivered to me of my Father: and no man knoweth who the Son is, but the Father; and who the Father is, but the Son, and he to whom the Son will reveal him.
