10:23.text: And he turned him unto his disciples, and said privately, Blessed are the eyes which see the things that ye see:

10:24.text: For I tell you, that many prophets and kings have desired to see those things which ye see, and have not seen them; and to hear those things which ye hear, and have not heard them.

10:25.text: And, behold, a certain lawyer stood up, and tempted him, saying, Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?

10:26.text: He said unto him, What is written in the law? how readest thou?

10:27.text: And he answering said, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy strength, and with all thy mind; and thy neighbour as thyself.

10:28.text: And he said unto him, Thou hast answered right: this do, and thou shalt live.

10:29.text: But he, willing to justify himself, said unto Jesus, And who is my neighbour?

10:30.text: And Jesus answering said, A certain man went down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell among thieves, which stripped him of his raiment, and wounded him, and departed, leaving him half dead.

10:31.text: And by chance there came down a certain priest that way: and when he saw him, he passed by on the other side.

10:32.text: And likewise a Levite, when he was at the place, came and looked on him, and passed by on the other side.

10:33.text: But a certain Samaritan, as he journeyed, came where he was: and when he saw him, he had compassion on him,

10:34.text: And went to him, and bound up his wounds, pouring in oil and wine, and set him on his own beast, and brought him to an inn, and took care of him.

10:35.text: And on the morrow when he departed, he took out two pence, and gave them to the host, and said unto him, Take care of him; and whatsoever thou spendest more, when I come again, I will repay thee.

10:36.text: Which now of these three, thinkest thou, was neighbour unto him that fell among the thieves?

10:37.text: And he said, He that shewed mercy on him. Then said Jesus unto him, Go, and do thou likewise.

10:38.text: Now it came to pass, as they went, that he entered into a certain village: and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house.

10:39.text: And she had a sister called Mary, which also sat at Jesus' feet, and heard his word.

10:40.text: But Martha was cumbered about much serving, and came to him, and said, Lord, dost thou not care that my sister hath left me to serve alone? bid her therefore that she help me.

10:41.text: And Jesus answered and said unto her, Martha, Martha, thou art careful and troubled about many things:

10:42.text: But one thing is needful: and Mary hath chosen that good part, which shall not be taken away from her.

10:43.text: And it came to pass, that, as he was praying in a certain place, when he ceased, one of his disciples said unto him, Lord, teach us to pray, as John also taught his disciples.

10:44.text: And he said unto them, When ye pray, say, Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name. Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done, as in heaven, so in earth.

10:45.text: Give us day by day our daily bread.

10:46.text: And forgive us our sins; for we also forgive every one that is indebted to us. And lead us not into temptation; but deliver us from evil.

10:47.text: And he said unto them, Which of you shall have a friend, and shall go unto him at midnight, and say unto him, Friend, lend me three loaves;

10:48.text: For a friend of mine in his journey is come to me, and I have nothing to set before him?

10:49.text: And he from within shall answer and say, Trouble me not: the door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed; I cannot rise and give thee.

10:50.text: I say unto you, Though he will not rise and give him, because he is his friend, yet because of his importunity he will rise and give him as many as he needeth.

10:51.text: And I say unto you, Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.

10:52.text: For every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.

10:53.text: If a son shall ask bread of any of you that is a father, will he give him a stone? or if he ask a fish, will he for a fish give him a serpent?

10:54.text: Or if he shall ask an egg, will he offer him a scorpion?

10:55.text: If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children: how much more shall your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to them that ask him?

10:56.text: And he was casting out a devil, and it was dumb. And it came to pass, when the devil was gone out, the dumb spake; and the people wondered.

10:57.text: But some of them said, He casteth out devils through Beelzebub the chief of the devils.

10:58.text: And others, tempting him, sought of him a sign from heaven.

10:59.text: But he, knowing their thoughts, said unto them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation; and a house divided against a house falleth.

11:00.text: Mark Chapter 11 - Jesus Cleanses the Temple

11:01.text: And when they came nigh to Jerusalem, unto Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount of Olives, he sendeth forth two of his disciples,

11:02.text: And saith unto them, Go your way into the village over against you: and as soon as ye be entered into it, ye shall find a colt tied, whereon never man sat; loose him, and bring him.

11:03.text: And if any man say unto you, Why do ye this? say ye that the Lord hath need of him; and straightway he will send him hither.

11:04.text: And they went their way, and found the colt tied by the door without in a place where two ways met; and they loose him.

11:05.text: And certain of them that stood there said unto them, What do ye, loosing the colt?

11:06.text: And they said unto them even as Jesus had commanded: and they let them go.

11:07.text: And they brought the colt to Jesus, and cast their garments on him; and he sat upon him.

11:08.text: And many spread their garments in the way: and others cut down branches off the trees, and strawed them in the way.

11:09.text: And they that went before, and they that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna; Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord:

11:10.text: Blessed be the kingdom of our father David, that cometh in the name of the Lord: Hosanna in the highest.

11:11.text: And Jesus entered into Jerusalem, and into the temple: and when he had looked round about upon all things, and now the eventide was come, he went out unto Bethany with the twelve.

11:12.text: And on the morrow, when they were come from Bethany, he was hungry:

11:13.text: And seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves, he came, if haply he might find any thing thereon: and when he came to it, he found nothing but leaves; for the time of figs was not yet.

11:14.text: And Jesus answered and said unto it, No man eat fruit of thee hereafter for ever. And his disciples heard it.

11:15.text: And they come to Jerusalem: and Jesus went into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of them that sold doves;

11:16.text: And would not suffer that any man should carry any vessel through the temple.

11:17.text: And he taught, saying unto them, Is it not written, My house shall be called of all nations the house of prayer? but ye have made it a den of thieves.

11:18.text: And the scribes and chief priests heard it, and sought how they might destroy him: for they feared him, because all the people was astonished at his doctrine.

11:19.text: And when even was come, he went out of the city.

11:20.text: And in the morning, as they passed by, they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots.

11:21.text: And Peter calling to remembrance saith unto him, Master, behold, the fig tree which thou cursedst is withered away.

11:22.text: And Jesus answering saith unto them, Have faith in God.

11:23.text: For verily I say unto you, That whosoever shall say unto this mountain, Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the sea; and shall not doubt in his heart, but shall believe that those things which he saith shall come to pass; he shall have whatsoever he saith.

11:24.text: Therefore I say unto you, What things soever ye desire, when ye pray, believe that ye receive them, and ye shall have them.

11:25.text: And when ye stand praying, forgive, if ye have ought against any: that your Father also which is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses.

11:26.text: But if ye do not forgive, neither will your Father which is in heaven forgive your trespasses.

11:27.text: And they come again to Jerusalem: and as he was walking in the temple, there come to him the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders,

11:28.text: And say unto him, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority to do these things?

11:29.text: And Jesus answered and said unto them, I will also ask of you one question, and answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.

11:30.text: The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or of men? answer me.

11:31.text: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then did ye not believe him?

11:32.text: But if we shall say, Of men; they feared the people: for all men counted John, that he was a prophet indeed.

11:33.text: And they answered and said unto Jesus, We cannot tell. And Jesus answering saith unto them, Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things.

11:34.text: And he began to speak unto them by parables. A certain man planted a vineyard, and set an hedge about it, and digged a place for the winefat, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into a far country.

11:35.text: And at the season he sent to the husbandmen a servant, that he might receive from the husbandmen of the fruit of the vineyard.

11:36.text: And they caught him, and beat him, and sent him away empty.

11:37.text: And again he sent unto them another servant; and at him they cast stones, and wounded him in the head, and sent him away shamefully handled.

11:38.text: And again he sent another; and him they killed, and many others; beating some, and killing some.

11:39.text: Having yet therefore one son, his wellbeloved, he sent him also last unto them, saying, They will reverence my son.

11:40.text: But those husbandmen said among themselves, This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and the inheritance shall be ours.

11:41.text: And they took him, and killed him, and cast him out of the vineyard.

11:42.text: What shall therefore the lord of the vineyard do? he will come and destroy the husbandmen, and will give the vineyard unto others.

11:43.text: And have ye not read this scripture; The stone which the builders rejected is become the head of the corner:

11:44.text: This was the Lord's doing, and it is marvellous in our eyes?

11:45.text: And they sought to lay hold on him, but feared the people: for they knew that he had spoken the parable against them: and they left him, and went their way.

11:46.text: And they send unto him certain of the Pharisees and of the Herodians, to catch him in his words.

11:47.text: And when they were come, they say unto him, Master, we know that thou art true, and carest for no man: for thou regardest not the person of men, but teachest the way of God in truth: Is it lawful to give tribute to Caesar, or not?

11:48.text: Shall we give, or shall we not give? But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said unto them, Why tempt ye me? bring me a penny, that I may see it.

11:49.text: And they brought it. And he saith unto them, Whose is this image and superscription? And they said unto him, Caesar's.

11:50.text: And Jesus answering said unto them, Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's. And they marvelled at him.

11:51.text: Then come unto him the Sadducees, which say there is no resurrection; and they asked him, saying,

11:52.text: Master, Moses wrote unto us, If a man's brother die, and leave his wife behind him, and leave no children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.

11:53.text: Now there were seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and dying left no seed.

11:54.text: And the second took her, and died, neither left he any seed: and the third likewise.

11:55.text: And the seven had her, and left no seed: last of all the woman died also.

11:56.text: In the resurrection therefore, when they shall rise, whose wife shall she be of them? for the seven had her to wife.

11:57.text: And Jesus answering said unto them, Do ye not therefore err, because ye know not the scriptures, neither the power of God?

11:58.text: For when they shall rise from the dead, they neither marry, nor are given in marriage; but are as the angels which are in heaven.

11:59.text: And as touching the dead, that they rise: have ye not read in the book of Moses, how in the bush God spake unto him, saying, I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?

12:00.text: John Chapter 12 - Jesus Anointed at Bethany

12:01.text: Then Jesus six days before the passover came to Bethany, where Lazarus was which had been dead, whom he raised from the dead.

12:02.text: There they made him a supper; and Martha served: but Lazarus was one of them that sat at the table with him.

12:03.text: Then took Mary a pound of ointment of spikenard, very costly, and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hair: and the house was filled with the odour of the ointment.

12:04.text: Then saith one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot, Simon's son, which should betray him,

12:05.text: Why was not this ointment sold for three hundred pence, and given to the poor?

12:06.text: This he said, not that he cared for the poor; but because he was a thief, and had the bag, and bare what was put therein.

12:07.text: Then said Jesus, Let her alone: against the day of my burying hath she kept this.

12:08.text: For the poor always ye have with you; but me ye have not always.

12:09.text: Much people of the Jews therefore knew that he was there: and they came not for Jesus' sake only, but that they might see Lazarus also, whom he had raised from the dead.

12:10.text: But the chief priests consulted that they might put Lazarus also to death;

12:11.text: Because that by reason of him many of the Jews went away, and believed on Jesus.

12:12.text: On the next day much people that were come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,

12:13.text: Took branches of palm trees, and went forth to meet him, and cried, Hosanna: Blessed is the King of Israel that cometh in the name of the Lord.

12:14.text: And Jesus, when he had found a young ass, sat thereon; as it is written,

12:15.text: Fear not, daughter of Sion: behold, thy King cometh, sitting on an ass's colt.

12:16.text: These things understood not his disciples at the first: but when Jesus was glorified, then remembered they that these things were written of him, and that they had done these things unto him.

12:17.text: The people therefore that was with him when he called Lazarus out of his grave, and raised him from the dead, bare record.

12:18.text: For this cause the people also met him, for that they heard that he had done this miracle.

12:19.text: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, Perceive ye how ye prevail nothing? behold, the world is gone after him.

12:20.text: And there were certain Greeks among them that came up to worship at the feast:

12:21.text: The same came therefore to Philip, which was of Bethsaida of Galilee, and desired him, saying, Sir, we would see Jesus.

12:22.text: Philip cometh and telleth Andrew: and again Andrew and Philip tell Jesus.

12:23.text: And Jesus answered them, saying, The hour is come, that the Son of man should be glorified.

12:24.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Except a corn of wheat fall into the ground and die, it abideth alone: but if it die, it bringeth forth much fruit.

12:25.text: He that loveth his life shall lose it; and he that hateth his life in this world shall keep it unto life eternal.

12:26.text: If any man serve me, let him follow me; and where I am, there shall also my servant be: if any man serve me, him will my Father honour.

12:27.text: Now is my soul troubled; and what shall I say? Father, save me from this hour: but for this cause came I unto this hour.

12:28.text: Father, glorify thy name. Then came there a voice from heaven, saying, I have both glorified it, and will glorify it again.

12:29.text: The people therefore, that stood by, and heard it, said that it thundered: others said, An angel spake to him.

12:30.text: Jesus answered and said, This voice came not because of me, but for your sakes.

12:31.text: Now is the judgment of this world: now shall the prince of this world be cast out.

12:32.text: And I, if I be lifted up from the earth, will draw all men unto me.

12:33.text: This he said, signifying what death he should die.

12:34.text: The people answered him, We have heard out of the law that Christ abideth for ever: and how sayest thou, The Son of man must be lifted up? who is this Son of man?

12:35.text: Then Jesus said unto them, Yet a little while is the light with you. Walk while ye have the light, lest darkness come upon you: for he that walketh in darkness knoweth not whither he goeth.

12:36.text: While ye have light, believe in the light, that ye may be the children of light. These things spake Jesus, and departed, and did hide himself from them.

12:37.text: But though he had done so many miracles before them, yet they believed not on him:

12:38.text: That the saying of Esaias the prophet might be fulfilled, which he spake, Lord, who hath believed our report? and to whom hath the arm of the Lord been revealed?

12:39.text: Therefore they could not believe, because that Esaias said again,

12:40.text: He hath blinded their eyes, and hardened their heart; that they should not see with their eyes, nor understand with their heart, and be converted, and I should heal them.

12:41.text: These things said Esaias, when he saw his glory, and spake of him.

12:42.text: Nevertheless among the chief rulers also many believed on him; but because of the Pharisees they did not confess him, lest they should be put out of the synagogue:

12:43.text: For they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.

12:44.text: Jesus cried and said, He that believeth on me, believeth not on me, but on him that sent me.

12:45.text: And he that seeth me seeth him that sent me.

12:46.text: I am come a light into the world, that whosoever believeth on me should not abide in darkness.

12:47.text: And if any man hear my words, and believe not, I judge him not: for I came not to judge the world, but to save the world.

12:48.text: He that rejecteth me, and receiveth not my words, hath one that judgeth him: the word that I have spoken, the same shall judge him in the last day.

12:49.text: For I have not spoken of myself; but the Father which sent me, he gave me a commandment, what I should say, and what I should speak.

12:50.text: And I know that his commandment is life everlasting: whatsoever I speak therefore, even as the Father said unto me, so I speak.

12:51.text: Now before the feast of the passover, when Jesus knew that his hour was come that he should depart out of this world unto the Father, having loved his own which were in the world, he loved them unto the end.

12:52.text: And supper being ended, the devil having now put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon's son, to betray him;

12:53.text: Jesus knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands, and that he was come from God, and went to God;

12:54.text: He riseth from supper, and laid aside his garments; and took a towel, and girded himself.

12:55.text: After that he poureth water into a bason, and began to wash the disciples' feet, and to wipe them with the towel wherewith he was girded.

12:56.text: Then cometh he to Simon Peter: and Peter saith unto him, Lord, dost thou wash my feet?

12:57.text: Jesus answered and said unto him, What I do thou knowest not now; but thou shalt know hereafter.

12:58.text: Peter saith unto him, Thou shalt never wash my feet. Jesus answered him, If I wash thee not, thou hast no part with me.

12:59.text: Simon Peter saith unto him, Lord, not my feet only, but also my hands and my head.

13:00.text: Matthew Chapter 13 - The Parable of the Sower

13:01.text: The same day went Jesus out of the house, and sat by the sea side.

13:02.text: And great multitudes were gathered together unto him, so that he went into a ship, and sat; and the whole multitude stood on the shore.

13:03.text: And he spake many things unto them in parables, saying, Behold, a sower went forth to sow;

13:04.text: And when he sowed, some seeds fell by the way side, and the fowls came and devoured them up:

13:05.text: Some fell upon stony places, where they had not much earth: and forthwith they sprung up, because they had no deepness of earth:

13:06.text: And when the sun was up, they were scorched; and because they had no root, they withered away.

13:07.text: And some fell among thorns; and the thorns sprung up, and choked them:

13:08.text: But other fell into good ground, and brought forth fruit, some an hundredfold, some sixtyfold, some thirtyfold.

13:09.text: Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.

13:10.text: And the disciples came, and said unto him, Why speakest thou unto them in parables?

13:11.text: He answered and said unto them, Because it is given unto you to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it is not given.

13:12.text: For whosoever hath, to him shall be given, and he shall have more abundance: but whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken away even that he hath.

13:13.text: Therefore speak I to them in parables: because they seeing see not; and hearing they hear not, neither do they understand.

13:14.text: And in them is fulfilled the prophecy of Esaias, which saith, By hearing ye shall hear, and shall not understand; and seeing ye shall see, and shall not perceive:

13:15.text: For this people's heart is waxed gross, and their ears are dull of hearing, and their eyes they have closed; lest at any time they should see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and should understand with their heart, and should be converted, and I should heal them.

13:16.text: But blessed are your eyes, for they see: and your ears, for they hear.

13:17.text: For verily I say unto you, That many prophets and righteous men have desired to see those things which ye see, and have not seen them; and to hear those things which ye hear, and have not heard them.

13:18.text: Hear ye therefore the parable of the sower.

13:19.text: When any one heareth the word of the kingdom, and understandeth it not, then cometh the wicked one, and catcheth away that which was sown in his heart. This is he which received seed by the way side.

13:20.text: But he that received the seed into stony places, the same is he that heareth the word, and anon with joy receiveth it;

13:21.text: Yet hath he not root in himself, but dureth for a while: for when tribulation or persecution ariseth because of the word, by and by he is offended.

13:22.text: He also that received seed among the thorns is he that heareth the word; and the care of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, choke the word, and he becometh unfruitful.

13:23.text: But he that received seed into the good ground is he that heareth the word, and understandeth it; which also beareth fruit, and bringeth forth, some an hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.

13:24.text: Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man which sowed good seed in his field:

13:25.text: But while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat, and went his way.

13:26.text: But when the blade was sprung up, and brought forth fruit, then appeared the tares also.

13:27.text: So the servants of the householder came and said unto him, Sir, didst not thou sow good seed in thy field? from whence then hath it tares?

13:28.text: He said unto them, An enemy hath done this. The servants said unto him, Wilt thou then that we go and gather them up?

13:29.text: But he said, Nay; lest while ye gather up the tares, ye root up also the wheat with them.

13:30.text: Let both grow together until the harvest: and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, Gather ye together first the tares, and bind them in bundles to burn them: but gather the wheat into my barn.

13:31.text: Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is like to a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and sowed in his field:

13:32.text: Which indeed is the least of all seeds: but when it is grown, it is the greatest among herbs, and becometh a tree, so that the birds of the air come and lodge in the branches thereof.

13:33.text: Another parable spake he unto them; The kingdom of heaven is like unto leaven, which a woman took, and hid in three measures of meal, till the whole was leavened.

13:34.text: All these things spake Jesus unto the multitude in parables; and without a parable spake he not unto them:

13:35.text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying, I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter things which have been kept secret from the foundation of the world.

13:36.text: Then Jesus sent the multitude away, and went into the house: and his disciples came unto him, saying, Declare unto us the parable of the tares of the field.

13:37.text: He answered and said unto them, He that soweth the good seed is the Son of man;

13:38.text: The field is the world; the good seed are the children of the kingdom; but the tares are the children of the wicked one;

13:39.text: The enemy that sowed them is the devil; the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are the angels.

13:40.text: As therefore the tares are gathered and burned in the fire; so shall it be in the end of this world.

13:41.text: The Son of man shall send forth his angels, and they shall gather out of his kingdom all things that offend, and them which do iniquity;

13:42.text: And shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.

13:43.text: Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.

13:44.text: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto treasure hid in a field; the which when a man hath found, he hideth, and for joy thereof goeth and selleth all that he hath, and buyeth that field.

13:45.text: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man, seeking goodly pearls:

13:46.text: Who, when he had found one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had, and bought it.

13:47.text: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a net, that was cast into the sea, and gathered of every kind:

13:48.text: Which, when it was full, they drew to shore, and sat down, and gathered the good into vessels, but cast the bad away.

13:49.text: So shall it be at the end of the world: the angels shall come forth, and sever the wicked from among the just,

13:50.text: And shall cast them into the furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.

13:51.text: Jesus saith unto them, Have ye understood all these things? They say unto him, Yea, Lord.

13:52.text: Then said he unto them, Therefore every scribe which is instructed unto the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man that is an householder, which bringeth forth out of his treasure things new and old.

13:53.text: And it came to pass, that when Jesus had finished these parables, he departed thence.

13:54.text: And when he was come into his own country, he taught them in their synagogue, insomuch that they were astonished, and said, Whence hath this man this wisdom, and these mighty works?

13:55.text: Is not this the carpenter's son? is not his mother called Mary? and his brethren, James, and Joses, and Simon, and Judas?

13:56.text: And his sisters, are they not all with us? Whence then hath this man all these things?

13:57.text: And they were offended in him. But Jesus said unto them, A prophet is not without honour, save in his own country, and in his own house.

13:58.text: And he did not many mighty works there because of their unbelief.

13:59.text: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus,

14:00.text: Luke Chapter 14 - The Parable of the Great Banquet

14:01.text: And it came to pass, as he went into the house of one of the chief Pharisees to eat bread on the sabbath day, that they watched him.

14:02.text: And, behold, there was a certain man before him which had the dropsy.

14:03.text: And Jesus answering spake unto the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath day?

14:04.text: And they held their peace. And he took him, and healed him, and let him go;

14:05.text: And answered them, saying, Which of you shall have an ass or an ox fallen into a pit, and will not straightway pull him out on the sabbath day?

14:06.text: And they could not answer him again to these things.

14:07.text: And he put forth a parable to those which were bidden, when he marked how they chose out the chief rooms; saying unto them,

14:08.text: When thou art bidden of any man to a wedding, sit not down in the highest room; lest a more honourable man than thou be bidden of him;

14:09.text: And he that bade thee and him come and say to thee, Give this man place; and thou begin with shame to take the lowest room.

14:10.text: But when thou art bidden, go and sit down in the lowest room; that when he that bade thee cometh, he may say unto thee, Friend, go up higher: then shalt thou have worship in the presence of them that sit at meat with thee.

14:11.text: For whosoever exalteth himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.

14:12.text: Then said he also to him that bade him, When thou makest a dinner or a supper, call not thy friends, nor thy brethren, neither thy kinsmen, nor thy rich neighbours; lest they also bid thee again, and a recompence be made thee.

14:13.text: But when thou makest a feast, call the poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind:

14:14.text: And thou shalt be blessed; for they cannot recompense thee: for thou shalt be recompensed at the resurrection of the just.

14:15.text: And when one of them that sat at meat with him heard these things, he said unto him, Blessed is he that shall eat bread in the kingdom of God.

14:16.text: Then said he unto him, A certain man made a great supper, and bade many:

14:17.text: And sent his servant at supper time to say to them that were bidden, Come; for all things are now ready.

14:18.text: And they all with one consent began to make excuse. The first said unto him, I have bought a piece of ground, and I must needs go and see it: I pray thee have me excused.

14:19.text: And another said, I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I go to prove them: I pray thee have me excused.

14:20.text: And another said, I have married a wife, and therefore I cannot come.

14:21.text: So that servant came, and shewed his lord these things. Then the master of the house being angry said to his servant, Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in hither the poor, and the maimed, and the halt, and the blind.

14:22.text: And the servant said, Lord, it is done as thou hast commanded, and yet there is room.

14:23.text: And the lord said unto the servant, Go out into the highways and hedges, and compel them to come in, that my house may be filled.

14:24.text: For I say unto you, That none of those men which were bidden shall taste of my supper.

14:25.text: And there went great multitudes with him: and he turned, and said unto them,

14:26.text: If any man come to me, and hate not his father, and mother, and wife, and children, and brethren, and sisters, yea, and his own life also, he cannot be my disciple.

14:27.text: And whosoever doth not bear his cross, and come after me, cannot be my disciple.

14:28.text: For which of you, intending to build a tower, sitteth not down first, and counteth the cost, whether he have sufficient to finish it?

14:29.text: Lest haply, after he hath laid the foundation, and is not able to finish it, all that behold it begin to mock him,

14:30.text: Saying, This man began to build, and was not able to finish.

14:31.text: Or what king, going to make war against another king, sitteth not down first, and consulteth whether he be able with ten thousand to meet him that cometh against him with twenty thousand?

14:32.text: Or else, while the other is yet a great way off, he sendeth an ambassage, and desireth conditions of peace.

14:33.text: So likewise, whosoever he be of you that forsaketh not all that he hath, he cannot be my disciple.

14:34.text: Salt is good: but if the salt have lost his savour, wherewith shall it be seasoned?

14:35.text: It is neither fit for the land, nor yet for the dunghill; but men cast it out. He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

14:36.text: Then drew near unto him all the publicans and sinners for to hear him.

14:37.text: And the Pharisees and scribes murmured, saying, This man receiveth sinners, and eateth with them.

14:38.text: And he spake this parable unto them, saying,

14:39.text: What man of you, having an hundred sheep, if he lose one of them, doth not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness, and go after that which is lost, until he find it?

14:40.text: And when he hath found it, he layeth it on his shoulders, rejoicing.

14:41.text: And when he cometh home, he calleth together his friends and neighbours, saying unto them, Rejoice with me; for I have found my sheep which was lost.

14:42.text: I say unto you, that likewise joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that repenteth, more than over ninety and nine just persons, which need no repentance.

14:43.text: Either what woman having ten pieces of silver, if she lose one piece, doth not light a candle, and sweep the house, and seek diligently till she find it?

14:44.text: And when she hath found it, she calleth her friends and her neighbours together, saying, Rejoice with me; for I have found the piece which I had lost.

14:45.text: Likewise, I say unto you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth.

14:46.text: And he said, A certain man had two sons:

14:47.text: And the younger of them said to his father, Father, give me the portion of goods that falleth to me. And he divided unto them his living.

14:48.text: And not many days after the younger son gathered all together, and took his journey into a far country, and there wasted his substance with riotous living.

14:49.text: And when he had spent all, there arose a mighty famine in that land; and he began to be in want.

14:50.text: And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine.

14:51.text: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine did eat: and no man gave unto him.

14:52.text: And when he came to himself, he said, How many hired servants of my father's have bread enough and to spare, and I perish with hunger!

14:53.text: I will arise and go to my father, and will say unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and before thee,

14:54.text: And am no more worthy to be called thy son: make me as one of thy hired servants.

14:55.text: And he arose, and came to his father. But when he was yet a great way off, his father saw him, and had compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.

14:56.text: And the son said unto him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in thy sight, and am no more worthy to be called thy son.

14:57.text: But the father said to his servants, Bring forth the best robe, and put it on him; and put a ring on his hand, and shoes on his feet:

14:58.text: And bring hither the fatted calf, and kill it; and let us eat, and be merry:

14:59.text: For this my son was dead, and is alive again; he was lost, and is found. And they began to be merry.

15:01.text: And straightway in the morning the chief priests held a consultation with the elders and scribes and the whole council, and bound Jesus, and carried him away, and delivered him to Pilate.

15:02.text: And Pilate asked him, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answering said unto them, Thou sayest it.

15:03.text: And the chief priests accused him of many things: but he answered nothing.

15:04.text: And Pilate asked him again, saying, Answerest thou nothing? behold how many things they witness against thee.

15:05.text: But Jesus yet answered nothing; so that Pilate marvelled.

15:06.text: Now at that feast he released unto them one prisoner, whomsoever they desired.

15:07.text: And there was one named Barabbas, which lay bound with them that had made insurrection with him, who had committed murder in the insurrection.

15:08.text: And the multitude crying aloud began to desire him to do as he had ever done unto them.

15:09.text: But Pilate answered them, saying, Will ye that I release unto you the King of the Jews?

15:10.text: For he knew that the chief priests had delivered him for envy.

15:11.text: But the chief priests moved the people, that he should rather release Barabbas unto them.

15:12.text: And Pilate answered and said again unto them, What will ye then that I shall do unto him whom ye call the King of the Jews?

15:13.text: And they cried out again, Crucify him.

15:14.text: Then Pilate said unto them, Why, what evil hath he done? And they cried out the more exceedingly, Crucify him.

15:15.text: And so Pilate, willing to content the people, released Barabbas unto them, and delivered Jesus, when he had scourged him, to be crucified.

15:16.text: And the soldiers led him away into the hall, called Praetorium; and they call together the whole band.

15:17.text: And they clothed him with purple, and platted a crown of thorns, and put it about his head,

15:18.text: And began to salute him, Hail, King of the Jews!

15:19.text: And they smote him on the head with a reed, and did spit upon him, and bowing their knees worshipped him.

15:20.text: And when they had mocked him, they took off the purple from him, and put his own clothes on him, and led him out to crucify him.

15:21.text: And they compel one Simon a Cyrenian, who passed by, coming out of the country, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to bear his cross.

15:22.text: And they bring him unto the place Golgotha, which is, being interpreted, The place of a skull.

15:23.text: And they gave him to drink wine mingled with myrrh: but he received it not.

15:24.text: And when they had crucified him, they parted his garments, casting lots upon them, what every man should take.

15:25.text: And it was the third hour, and they crucified him.

15:26.text: And the superscription of his accusation was written over, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

15:27.text: And with him they crucify two thieves; the one on his right hand, and the other on his left.

15:28.text: And the scripture was fulfilled, which saith, And he was numbered with the transgressors.

15:29.text: And they that passed by railed on him, wagging their heads, and saying, Ah, thou that destroyest the temple, and buildest it in three days,

15:30.text: Save thyself, and come down from the cross.

15:31.text: Likewise also the chief priests mocking said among themselves with the scribes, He saved others; himself he cannot save.

15:32.text: Let Christ the King of Israel descend now from the cross, that we may see and believe. And they that were crucified with him reviled him.

15:33.text: And when the sixth hour was come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.

15:34.text: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani? which is, being interpreted, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?

15:35.text: And some of them that stood by, when they heard it, said, Behold, he calleth Elias.

15:36.text: And one ran and filled a spunge full of vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him to drink, saying, Let alone; let us see whether Elias will come to take him down.

15:37.text: And Jesus cried with a loud voice, and gave up the ghost.

15:38.text: And the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom.

15:39.text: And when the centurion, which stood over against him, saw that he so cried out, and gave up the ghost, he said, Truly this man was the Son of God.

15:40.text: There were also women looking on afar off: among whom was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;

15:41.text: (Who also, when he was in Galilee, followed him, and ministered unto him;) and many other women which came up with him unto Jerusalem.

15:42.text: And now when the even was come, because it was the preparation, that is, the day before the sabbath,

15:43.text: Joseph of Arimathaea, an honourable counsellor, which also waited for the kingdom of God, came, and went in boldly unto Pilate, and craved the body of Jesus.

15:44.text: And Pilate marvelled if he were already dead: and calling unto him the centurion, he asked him whether he had been any while dead.

15:45.text: And when he knew it of the centurion, he gave the body to Joseph.

15:46.text: And he bought fine linen, and took him down, and wrapped him in the linen, and laid him in a sepulchre which was hewn out of a rock, and rolled a stone unto the door of the sepulchre.

15:47.text: And Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses beheld where he was laid.

15:48.text: These things have I spoken unto you, that ye should not be offended.

15:49.text: They shall put you out of the synagogues: yea, the time cometh, that whosoever killeth you will think that he doeth God service.

15:50.text: And these things will they do unto you, because they have not known the Father, nor me.

15:51.text: But these things have I told you, that when the time shall come, ye may remember that I told you of them. And these things I said not unto you at the beginning, because I was with you.

15:52.text: But now I go my way to him that sent me; and none of you asketh me, Whither goest thou?

15:53.text: But because I have said these things unto you, sorrow hath filled your heart.

15:54.text: Nevertheless I tell you the truth; It is expedient for you that I go away: for if I go not away, the Comforter will not come unto you; but if I depart, I will send him unto you.

15:55.text: And when he is come, he will reprove the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:

15:56.text: Of sin, because they believe not on me;

15:57.text: Of righteousness, because I go to my Father, and ye see me no more;

15:58.text: Of judgment, because the prince of this world is judged.

15:59.text: I have yet many things to say unto you, but ye cannot bear them now.

16:00.text: John Chapter 16 - The Work of the Holy Spirit

16:01.text: These things have I spoken unto you, that ye should not be offended.

16:02.text: They shall put you out of the synagogues: yea, the time cometh, that whosoever killeth you will think that he doeth God service.

16:03.text: And these things will they do unto you, because they have not known the Father, nor me.

16:04.text: But these things have I told you, that when the time shall come, ye may remember that I told you of them. And these things I said not unto you at the beginning, because I was with you.

16:05.text: But now I go my way to him that sent me; and none of you asketh me, Whither goest thou?

16:06.text: But because I have said these things unto you, sorrow hath filled your heart.

16:07.text: Nevertheless I tell you the truth; It is expedient for you that I go away: for if I go not away, the Comforter will not come unto you; but if I depart, I will send him unto you.

16:08.text: And when he is come, he will reprove the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:

16:09.text: Of sin, because they believe not on me;

16:10.text: Of righteousness, because I go to my Father, and ye see me no more;

16:11.text: Of judgment, because the prince of this world is judged.

16:12.text: I have yet many things to say unto you, but ye cannot bear them now.

16:13.text: Howbeit when he, the Spirit of truth, is come, he will guide you into all truth: for he shall not speak of himself; but whatsoever he shall hear, that shall he speak: and he will shew you things to come.

16:14.text: He shall glorify me: for he shall receive of mine, and shall shew it unto you.

16:15.text: All things that the Father hath are mine: therefore said I, that he shall take of mine, and shall shew it unto you.

16:16.text: A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me, because I go to the Father.

16:17.text: Then said some of his disciples among themselves, What is this that he saith unto us, A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me: and, Because I go to the Father?

16:18.text: They said therefore, What is this that he saith, A little while? we cannot tell what he saith.

16:19.text: Now Jesus knew that they were desirous to ask him, and said unto them, Do ye enquire among yourselves of that I said, A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me?

16:20.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, That ye shall weep and lament, but the world shall rejoice: and ye shall be sorrowful, but your sorrow shall be turned into joy.

16:21.text: A woman when she is in travail hath sorrow, because her hour is come: but as soon as she is delivered of the child, she remembereth no more the anguish, for joy that a man is born into the world.

16:22.text: And ye now therefore have sorrow: but I will see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no man taketh from you.

16:23.text: And in that day ye shall ask me nothing. Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whatsoever ye shall ask the Father in my name, he will give it you.

16:24.text: Hitherto have ye asked nothing in my name: ask, and ye shall receive, that your joy may be full.

16:25.text: These things have I spoken unto you in proverbs: but the time cometh, when I shall no more speak unto you in proverbs, but I shall shew you plainly of the Father.

16:26.text: At that day ye shall ask in my name: and I say not unto you, that I will pray the Father for you:

16:27.text: For the Father himself loveth you, because ye have loved me, and have believed that I came out from God.

16:28.text: I came forth from the Father, and am come into the world: again, I leave the world, and go to the Father.

16:29.text: His disciples said unto him, Lo, now speakest thou plainly, and speakest no proverb.

16:30.text: Now are we sure that thou knowest all things, and needest not that any man should ask thee: by this we believe that thou camest forth from God.

16:31.text: Jesus answered them, Do ye now believe?

16:32.text: Behold, the hour cometh, yea, is now come, that ye shall be scattered, every man to his own, and shall leave me alone: and yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.

16:33.text: These things I have spoken unto you, that in me ye might have peace. In the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world.

16:34.text: And after six days Jesus taketh Peter, James, and John his brother, and bringeth them up into an high mountain apart,

16:35.text: And was transfigured before them: and his face did shine as the sun, and his raiment was white as the light.

16:36.text: And, behold, there appeared unto them Moses and Elias talking with him.

16:37.text: Then answered Peter, and said unto Jesus, Lord, it is good for us to be here: if thou wilt, let us make here three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.

16:38.text: While he yet spake, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them: and behold a voice out of the cloud, which said, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased; hear ye him.

16:39.text: And when the disciples heard it, they fell on their face, and were sore afraid.

16:40.text: And Jesus came and touched them, and said, Arise, and be not afraid.

16:41.text: And when they had lifted up their eyes, they saw no man, save Jesus only.

16:42.text: And as they came down from the mountain, Jesus charged them, saying, Tell the vision to no man, until the Son of man be risen again from the dead.

16:43.text: And his disciples asked him, saying, Why then say the scribes that Elias must first come?

16:44.text: And Jesus answered and said unto them, Elias truly shall first come, and restore all things.

16:45.text: But I say unto you, That Elias is come already, and they knew him not, but have done unto him whatsoever they listed. Likewise shall also the Son of man suffer of them.

16:46.text: Then the disciples understood that he spake unto them of John the Baptist.

16:47.text: And when they were come to the multitude, there came to him a certain man, kneeling down to him, and saying,

16:48.text: Lord, have mercy on my son: for he is lunatick, and sore vexed: for ofttimes he falleth into the fire, and oft into the water.

16:49.text: And I brought him to thy disciples, and they could not cure him.

16:50.text: Then Jesus answered and said, O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I suffer you? bring him hither to me.

16:51.text: And Jesus rebuked the devil; and he departed out of him: and the child was cured from that very hour.

16:52.text: Then came the disciples to Jesus apart, and said, Why could not we cast him out?

16:53.text: And Jesus said unto them, Because of your unbelief: for verily I say unto you, If ye have faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye shall say unto this mountain, Remove hence to yonder place; and it shall remove; and nothing shall be impossible unto you.

16:54.text: Howbeit this kind goeth not out but by prayer and fasting.

16:55.text: And while they abode in Galilee, Jesus said unto them, The Son of man shall be betrayed into the hands of men:

16:56.text: And they shall kill him, and the third day he shall be raised again. And they were exceeding sorry.

16:57.text: And when they were come to Capernaum, they that received tribute money came to Peter, and said, Doth not your master pay tribute?

16:58.text: He saith, Yes. And when he was come into the house, Jesus prevented him, saying, What thinkest thou, Simon? of whom do the kings of the earth take custom or tribute? of their own children, or of strangers?

16:59.text: Peter saith unto him, Of strangers. Jesus saith unto him, Then are the children free.

17:01.text: And after six days Jesus taketh Peter, James, and John his brother, and bringeth them up into an high mountain apart,

17:02.text: And was transfigured before them: and his face did shine as the sun, and his raiment was white as the light.

17:03.text: And, behold, there appeared unto them Moses and Elias talking with him.

17:04.text: Then answered Peter, and said unto Jesus, Lord, it is good for us to be here: if thou wilt, let us make here three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.

17:05.text: While he yet spake, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them: and behold a voice out of the cloud, which said, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased; hear ye him.

17:06.text: And when the disciples heard it, they fell on their face, and were sore afraid.

17:08.text: And when they had lifted up their eyes, they saw no man, save Jesus only.

17:12.text: But I say unto you, That Elias is come already, and they knew him not, but have done unto him whatsoever they listed. Likewise shall also the Son of man suffer of them.

17:13.text: Then the disciples understood that he spake unto them of John the Baptist.

17:15.text: Lord, have mercy on my son: for he is lunatick, and sore vexed: for ofttimes he falleth into the fire, and oft into the water.

17:16.text: And I brought him to thy disciples, and they could not cure him.

17:17.text: Then Jesus answered and said, O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I suffer you? bring him hither to me.

17:18.text: And Jesus rebuked the devil; and he departed out of him: and the child was cured from that very hour.

17:19.text: Then came the disciples to Jesus apart, and said, Why could not we cast him out?

17:20.text: And Jesus said unto them, Because of your unbelief: for verily I say unto you, If ye have faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye shall say unto this mountain, Remove hence to yonder place; and it shall remove; and nothing shall be impossible unto you.

17:21.text: Howbeit this kind goeth not out but by prayer and fasting.

17:22.text: And while they abode in Galilee, Jesus said unto them, The Son of man shall be betrayed into the hands of men:

17:23.text: And they shall kill him, and the third day he shall be raised again. And they were exceeding sorry.

17:24.text: And when they were come to Capernaum, they that received tribute money came to Peter, and said, Doth not your master pay tribute?

17:25.text: He saith, Yes. And when he was come into the house, Jesus prevented him, saying, What thinkest thou, Simon? of whom do the kings of the earth take custom or tribute? of their own children, or of strangers?

17:26.text: Peter saith unto him, Of strangers. Jesus saith unto him, Then are the children free.

17:27.text: Notwithstanding, lest we should offend them, go thou to the sea, and cast an hook, and take up the fish that first cometh up; and when thou hast opened his mouth, thou shalt find a piece of money: that take, and give unto them for me and thee.

17:28.text: And he spake a parable unto them to this end, that men ought always to pray, and not to faint;

17:29.text: Saying, There was in a city a judge, which feared not God, neither regarded man:

17:30.text: And there was a widow in that city; and she came unto him, saying, Avenge me of mine adversary.

17:31.text: And he would not for a while: but afterward he said within himself, Though I fear not God, nor regard man;

17:32.text: Yet because this widow troubleth me, I will avenge her, lest by her continual coming she weary me.

17:33.text: And the Lord said, Hear what the unjust judge saith.

17:34.text: And shall not God avenge his own elect, which cry day and night unto him, though he bear long with them?

17:35.text: I tell you that he will avenge them speedily. Nevertheless when the Son of man cometh, shall he find faith on the earth?

17:36.text: And he spake this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and despised others:

17:37.text: Two men went up into the temple to pray; the one a Pharisee, and the other a publican.

17:38.text: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself, God, I thank thee, that I am not as other men are, extortioners, unjust, adulterers, or even as this publican.

17:39.text: I fast twice in the week, I give tithes of all that I possess.

17:40.text: And the publican, standing afar off, would not lift up so much as his eyes unto heaven, but smote upon his breast, saying, God be merciful to me a sinner.

17:41.text: I tell you, this man went down to his house justified rather than the other: for every one that exalteth himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.

17:42.text: And they brought unto him also infants, that he would touch them: but when his disciples saw it, they rebuked them.

17:43.text: But Jesus called them unto him, and said, Suffer little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.

17:44.text: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall in no wise enter therein.

17:45.text: And a certain ruler asked him, saying, Good Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?

17:46.text: And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good? none is good, save one, that is, God.

17:47.text: Thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Honour thy father and thy mother.

17:48.text: And he said, All these have I kept from my youth up.

17:49.text: Now when Jesus heard these things, he said unto him, Yet lackest thou one thing: sell all that thou hast, and distribute unto the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, follow me.

17:50.text: And when he heard this, he was very sorrowful: for he was very rich.

17:51.text: And when Jesus saw that he was very sorrowful, he said, How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!

17:52.text: For it is easier for a camel to go through a needle's eye, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

17:53.text: And they that heard it said, Who then can be saved?

17:54.text: And he said, The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.

17:55.text: Then Peter said, Lo, we have left all, and followed thee.

17:56.text: And he said unto them, Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or parents, or brethren, or wife, or children, for the kingdom of God's sake,

17:57.text: Who shall not receive manifold more in this present time, and in the world to come life everlasting.

17:58.text: Then he took unto him the twelve, and said unto them, Behold, we go up to Jerusalem, and all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of man shall be accomplished.

17:59.text: For he shall be delivered unto the Gentiles, and shall be mocked, and spitefully entreated, and spitted on:
