18:30.text: Who shall not receive manifold more in this present time, and in the world to come life everlasting.

18:31.text: Then he took unto him the twelve, and said unto them, Behold, we go up to Jerusalem, and all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of man shall be accomplished.

18:32.text: For he shall be delivered unto the Gentiles, and shall be mocked, and spitefully entreated, and spitted on:

18:33.text: And they shall scourge him, and put him to death: and the third day he shall rise again.

18:34.text: And they understood none of these things: and this saying was hid from them, neither knew they the things which were spoken.

18:35.text: And it came to pass, that as he was come nigh unto Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the way side begging:

18:36.text: And hearing the multitude pass by, he asked what it meant.

18:37.text: And they told him, that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by.

18:38.text: And he cried, saying, Jesus, thou son of David, have mercy on me.

18:39.text: And they which went before rebuked him, that he should hold his peace: but he cried so much the more, Thou son of David, have mercy on me.

18:40.text: And Jesus stood, and commanded him to be brought unto him: and when he was come near, he asked him,

18:41.text: Saying, What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee? And he said, Lord, that I may receive my sight.

18:42.text: And Jesus said unto him, Receive thy sight: thy faith hath saved thee.

18:43.text: And immediately he received his sight, and followed him, glorifying God: and all the people, when they saw it, gave praise unto God.

18:44.text: And he arose from thence, and cometh into the coasts of Judaea by the farther side of Jordan: and the people resort unto him again; and, as he was wont, he taught them again.

18:45.text: And the Pharisees came to him, and asked him, Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife? tempting him.

18:46.text: And he answered and said unto them, What did Moses command you?

18:47.text: And they said, Moses suffered to write a bill of divorcement, and to put her away.

18:48.text: And Jesus answered and said unto them, For the hardness of your heart he wrote you this precept.

18:49.text: But from the beginning of the creation God made them male and female.

18:50.text: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and cleave to his wife;

18:51.text: And they twain shall be one flesh: so then they are no more twain, but one flesh.

18:52.text: What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.

18:53.text: And in the house his disciples asked him again of the same matter.

18:54.text: And he saith unto them, Whosoever shall put away his wife, and marry another, committeth adultery against her.

18:55.text: And if a woman shall put away her husband, and be married to another, she committeth adultery.

18:56.text: And they brought young children to him, that he should touch them: and his disciples rebuked those that brought them.

18:57.text: But when Jesus saw it, he was much displeased, and said unto them, Suffer the little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.

18:58.text: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child, he shall not enter therein.

18:59.text: And he took them up in his arms, put his hands upon them, and blessed them.

19:01.text: And he arose from thence, and cometh into the coasts of Judaea by the farther side of Jordan: and the people resort unto him again; and, as he was wont, he taught them again.

19:02.text: And the Pharisees came to him, and asked him, Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife? tempting him.

19:03.text: And he answered and said unto them, What did Moses command you?

19:04.text: And they said, Moses suffered to write a bill of divorcement, and to put her away.

19:05.text: And Jesus answered and said unto them, For the hardness of your heart he wrote you this precept.

19:06.text: But from the beginning of the creation God made them male and female.

19:07.text: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and cleave to his wife;

19:08.text: And they twain shall be one flesh: so then they are no more twain, but one flesh.

19:09.text: What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.

19:10.text: And in the house his disciples asked him again of the same matter.

19:11.text: And he saith unto them, Whosoever shall put away his wife, and marry another, committeth adultery against her.

19:12.text: And if a woman shall put away her husband, and be married to another, she committeth adultery.

19:13.text: And they brought young children to him, that he should touch them: and his disciples rebuked those that brought them.

19:14.text: But when Jesus saw it, he was much displeased, and said unto them, Suffer the little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.

19:15.text: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child, he shall not enter therein.

19:16.text: And he took them up in his arms, put his hands upon them, and blessed them.

19:17.text: And when he was gone forth into the way, there came one running, and kneeled to him, and asked him, Good Master, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?

19:18.text: And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good? there is none good but one, that is, God.

19:19.text: Thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Defraud not, Honour thy father and mother.

19:20.text: And he answered and said unto him, Master, all these have I observed from my youth.

19:21.text: Then Jesus beholding him loved him, and said unto him, One thing thou lackest: go thy way, sell whatsoever thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, take up the cross, and follow me.

19:22.text: And he was sad at that saying, and went away grieved: for he had great possessions.

19:23.text: And Jesus looked round about, and saith unto his disciples, How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!

19:24.text: And the disciples were astonished at his words. But Jesus answereth again, and saith unto them, Children, how hard is it for them that trust in riches to enter into the kingdom of God!

19:25.text: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

19:26.text: And they were astonished out of measure, saying among themselves, Who then can be saved?

19:27.text: And Jesus looking upon them saith, With men it is impossible, but not with God: for with God all things are possible.

19:28.text: Then Peter began to say unto him, Lo, we have left all, and have followed thee.

19:29.text: And Jesus answered and said, Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my sake, and the gospel's,

19:30.text: But he shall receive an hundredfold now in this time, houses, and brethren, and sisters, and mothers, and children, and lands, with persecutions; and in the world to come eternal life.

19:31.text: But many that are first shall be last; and the last first.

19:32.text: And they were in the way going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus went before them: and they were amazed; and as they followed, they were afraid. And he took again the twelve, and began to tell them what things should happen unto him,

19:33.text: Saying, Behold, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of man shall be delivered unto the chief priests, and unto the scribes; and they shall condemn him to death, and shall deliver him to the Gentiles:

19:34.text: And they shall mock him, and shall scourge him, and shall spit upon him, and shall kill him: and the third day he shall rise again.

19:35.text: And James and John, the sons of Zebedee, come unto him, saying, Master, we would that thou shouldest do for us whatsoever we shall desire.

19:36.text: And he said unto them, What would ye that I should do for you?

19:37.text: They said unto him, Grant unto us that we may sit, one on thy right hand, and the other on thy left hand, in thy glory.

19:38.text: But Jesus said unto them, Ye know not what ye ask: can ye drink of the cup that I drink of? and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?

19:39.text: And they said unto him, We can. And Jesus said unto them, Ye shall indeed drink of the cup that I drink of; and with the baptism that I am baptized withal shall ye be baptized:

19:40.text: But to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give; but it shall be given to them for whom it is prepared.

19:41.text: And when the ten heard it, they began to be much displeased with James and John.

19:42.text: But Jesus called them to him, and saith unto them, Ye know that they which are accounted to rule over the Gentiles exercise lordship over them; and their great ones exercise authority upon them.

19:43.text: But so shall it not be among you: but whosoever will be great among you, shall be your minister:

19:44.text: And whosoever of you will be the chiefest, shall be servant of all.

19:45.text: For even the Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.

19:46.text: And they came to Jericho: and as he went out of Jericho with his disciples and a great number of people, blind Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus, sat by the highway side begging.

19:47.text: And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out, and say, Jesus, thou son of David, have mercy on me.

19:48.text: The first day of the week cometh Mary Magdalene early, when it was yet dark, unto the sepulchre, and seeth the stone taken away from the sepulchre.

19:49.text: Then she runneth, and cometh to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and saith unto them, They have taken away the LORD out of the sepulchre, and we know not where they have laid him.

19:50.text: Peter therefore went forth, and that other disciple, and came to the sepulchre.

19:51.text: So they ran both together: and the other disciple did outrun Peter, and came first to the sepulchre.

19:52.text: And he stooping down, and looking in, saw the linen clothes lying; yet went he not in.

19:53.text: Then cometh Simon Peter following him, and went into the sepulchre, and seeth the linen clothes lie,

19:54.text: And the napkin, that was about his head, not lying with the linen clothes, but wrapped together in a place by itself.

19:55.text: Then went in also that other disciple, which came first to the sepulchre, and he saw, and believed.

19:56.text: For as yet they knew not the scripture, that he must rise again from the dead.

19:57.text: Then the disciples went away again unto their own home.

19:58.text: But Mary stood without at the sepulchre weeping: and as she wept, she stooped down, and looked into the sepulchre,

19:59.text: And seeth two angels in white sitting, the one at the head, and the other at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.

20:01.text: The first day of the week cometh Mary Magdalene early, when it was yet dark, unto the sepulchre, and seeth the stone taken away from the sepulchre.

20:02.text: Then she runneth, and cometh to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and saith unto them, They have taken away the Lord out of the sepulchre, and we know not where they have laid him.

20:03.text: Peter therefore went forth, and that other disciple, and came to the sepulchre.

20:04.text: So they ran both together: and the other disciple did outrun Peter, and came first to the sepulchre.

20:05.text: And he stooping down, and looking in, saw the linen clothes lying; yet went he not in.

20:06.text: Then cometh Simon Peter following him, and went into the sepulchre, and seeth the linen clothes lie,

20:07.text: And the napkin, that was about his head, not lying with the linen clothes, but wrapped together in a place by itself.

20:08.text: Then went in also that other disciple, which came first to the sepulchre, and he saw, and believed.

20:09.text: For as yet they knew not the scripture, that he must rise again from the dead.

20:10.text: Then the disciples went away again unto their own home.

20:11.text: But Mary stood without at the sepulchre weeping: and as she wept, she stooped down, and looked into the sepulchre,

20:12.text: And seeth two angels in white sitting, the one at the head, and the other at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.

20:13.text: And they say unto her, Woman, why weepest thou? She saith unto them, Because they have taken away my Lord, and I know not where they have laid him.

20:14.text: And when she had thus said, she turned herself back, and saw Jesus standing, and knew not that it was Jesus.

20:15.text: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, why weepest thou? whom seekest thou? She, supposing him to be the gardener, saith unto him, Sir, if thou have borne him hence, tell me where thou hast laid him, and I will take him away.

20:16.text: Jesus saith unto her, Mary. She turned herself, and saith unto him, Rabboni; which is to say, Master.

20:17.text: Jesus saith unto her, Touch me not; for I am not yet ascended to my Father: but go to my brethren, and say unto them, I ascend unto my Father, and your Father; and to my God, and your God.

20:18.text: Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord, and that he had spoken these things unto her.

20:19.text: Then the same day at evening, being the first day of the week, when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled for fear of the Jews, came Jesus and stood in the midst, and saith unto them, Peace be unto you.

20:20.text: And when he had so said, he shewed unto them his hands and his side. Then were the disciples glad, when they saw the Lord.

20:21.text: Then said Jesus to them again, Peace be unto you: as my Father hath sent me, even so send I you.

20:22.text: And when he had said this, he breathed on them, and saith unto them, Receive ye the Holy Ghost:

20:23.text: Whose soever sins ye remit, they are remitted unto them; and whose soever sins ye retain, they are retained.

20:24.text: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.

20:25.text: The other disciples therefore said unto him, We have seen the Lord. But he said unto them, Except I shall see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the print of the nails, and thrust my hand into his side, I will not believe.

20:26.text: And after eight days again his disciples were within, and Thomas with them: then came Jesus, the doors being shut, and stood in the midst, and said, Peace be unto you.

20:27.text: Then saith he to Thomas, Reach hither thy finger, and behold my hands; and reach hither thy hand, and thrust it into my side: and be not faithless, but believing.

20:28.text: And Thomas answered and said unto him, My Lord and my God.

20:29.text: Jesus saith unto him, Thomas, because thou hast seen me, thou hast believed: blessed are they that have not seen, and yet have believed.

20:30.text: And many other signs truly did Jesus in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book:

20:31.text: But these are written, that ye might believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God; and that believing ye might have life through his name.

20:32.text: After these things Jesus shewed himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias; and on this wise shewed he himself.

20:33.text: There were together Simon Peter, and Thomas called Didymus, and Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and two other of his disciples.

20:34.text: Simon Peter saith unto them, I go a fishing. They say unto him, We also go with thee. They went forth, and entered into a ship immediately; and that night they caught nothing.

20:35.text: But when the morning was now come, Jesus stood on the shore: but the disciples knew not that it was Jesus.

20:36.text: Then Jesus saith unto them, Children, have ye any meat? They answered him, No.

20:37.text: And he said unto them, Cast the net on the right side of the ship, and ye shall find. They cast therefore, and now they were not able to draw it for the multitude of fishes.

20:38.text: Therefore that disciple whom Jesus loved saith unto Peter, It is the Lord. Now when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he girt his fisher's coat unto him, (for he was naked,) and did cast himself into the sea.

20:39.text: And the other disciples came in a little ship; (for they were not far from land, but as it were two hundred cubits,) dragging the net with fishes.

20:40.text: As soon then as they were come to land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid thereon, and bread.

20:41.text: Jesus saith unto them, Bring of the fish which ye have now caught.

20:42.text: Simon Peter went up, and drew the net to land full of great fishes, an hundred and fifty and three: and for all there were so many, yet was not the net broken.

20:43.text: Jesus saith unto them, Come and dine. And none of the disciples durst ask him, Who art thou? knowing that it was the Lord.

20:44.text: Jesus then cometh, and taketh bread, and giveth them, and fish likewise.

20:45.text: This is now the third time that Jesus shewed himself to his disciples, after that he was risen from the dead.

20:46.text: So when they had dined, Jesus saith to Simon Peter, Simon, son of Jonas, lovest thou me more than these? He saith unto him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I love thee. He saith unto him, Feed my lambs.

20:47.text: He saith to him again the second time, Simon, son of Jonas, lovest thou me? He saith unto him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I love thee. He saith unto him, Feed my sheep.

20:48.text: He saith unto him the third time, Simon, son of Jonas, lovest thou me? Peter was grieved because he said unto him the third time, Lovest thou me? And he said unto him, Lord, thou knowest all things; thou knowest that I love thee. Jesus saith unto him, Feed my sheep.

20:49.text: Verily, verily, I say unto thee, When thou wast young, thou girdedst thyself, and walkedst whither thou wouldest: but when thou shalt be old, thou shalt stretch forth thy hands, and another shall gird thee, and carry thee whither thou wouldest not.

20:50.text: This spake he, signifying by what death he should glorify God. And when he had spoken this, he saith unto him, Follow me.

20:51.text: Then Peter, turning about, seeth the disciple whom Jesus loved following; which also leaned on his breast at supper, and said, Lord, which is he that betrayeth thee?

20:52.text: Peter seeing him saith to Jesus, Lord, and what shall this man do?

20:53.text: Jesus saith unto him, If I will that he tarry till I come, what is that to thee? follow thou me.

20:54.text: Then went this saying abroad among the brethren, that that disciple should not die: yet Jesus said not unto him, He shall not die; but, If I will that he tarry till I come, what is that to thee?

20:55.text: This is the disciple which testifieth of these things, and wrote these things: and we know that his testimony is true.

20:56.text: And there are also many other things which Jesus did, the which, if they should be written every one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that should be written. Amen.

20:57.text: The book of the generation of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.

20:58.text: Abraham begat Isaac; and Isaac begat Jacob; and Jacob begat Judas and his brethren;

20:59.text: And Judas begat Phares and Zara of Thamar; and Phares begat Esrom; and Esrom begat Aram;

21:01.text: And when they drew nigh unto Jerusalem, and were come to Bethphage, unto the mount of Olives, then sent Jesus two disciples,

21:02.text: Saying unto them, Go into the village over against you, and straightway ye shall find an ass tied, and a colt with her: loose them, and bring them unto me.

21:03.text: And if any man say ought unto you, ye shall say, The Lord hath need of them; and straightway he will send them.

21:04.text: All this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying,

21:05.text: Tell ye the daughter of Sion, Behold, thy King cometh unto thee, meek, and sitting upon an ass, and a colt the foal of an ass.

21:06.text: And the disciples went, and did as Jesus commanded them,

21:07.text: And brought the ass, and the colt, and put on them their clothes, and they set him thereon.

21:08.text: And a very great multitude spread their garments in the way; others cut down branches from the trees, and strawed them in the way.

21:09.text: And the multitudes that went before, and that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna to the Son of David: Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord; Hosanna in the highest.

21:10.text: And when he was come into Jerusalem, all the city was moved, saying, Who is this?

21:11.text: And the multitude said, This is Jesus the prophet of Nazareth of Galilee.

21:12.text: And Jesus went into the temple of God, and cast out all them that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of them that sold doves,

21:13.text: And said unto them, It is written, My house shall be called the house of prayer; but ye have made it a den of thieves.

21:14.text: And the blind and the lame came to him in the temple; and he healed them.

21:15.text: And when the chief priests and scribes saw the wonderful things that he did, and the children crying in the temple, and saying, Hosanna to the Son of David; they were sore displeased,

21:16.text: And said unto him, Hearest thou what these say? And Jesus saith unto them, Yea; have ye never read, Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings thou hast perfected praise?

21:17.text: And he left them, and went out of the city into Bethany; and he lodged there.

21:18.text: Now in the morning as he returned into the city, he hungered.

21:19.text: And when he saw a fig tree in the way, he came to it, and found nothing thereon, but leaves only, and said unto it, Let no fruit grow on thee henceforward for ever. And presently the fig tree withered away.

21:20.text: And when the disciples saw it, they marvelled, saying, How soon is the fig tree withered away!

21:21.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, Verily I say unto you, If ye have faith, and doubt not, ye shall not only do this which is done to the fig tree, but also if ye shall say unto this mountain, Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the sea; it shall be done.

21:22.text: And all things, whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive.

21:23.text: And when he was come into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came unto him as he was teaching, and said, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority?

21:24.text: And Jesus answered and said unto them, I also will ask you one thing, which if ye tell me, I in like wise will tell you by what authority I do these things.

21:25.text: The baptism of John, whence was it? from heaven, or of men? And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say unto us, Why did ye not then believe him?

21:26.text: But if we shall say, Of men; we fear the people; for all hold John as a prophet.

21:27.text: And they answered Jesus, and said, We cannot tell. And he said unto them, Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.

21:28.text: But what think ye? A certain man had two sons; and he came to the first, and said, Son, go work to day in my vineyard.

21:29.text: He answered and said, I will not: but afterward he repented, and went.

21:30.text: And he came to the second, and said likewise. And he answered and said, I go, sir: and went not.

21:31.text: Whether of them twain did the will of his father? They say unto him, The first. Jesus saith unto them, Verily I say unto you, That the publicans and the harlots go into the kingdom of God before you.

21:32.text: For John came unto you in the way of righteousness, and ye believed him not: but the publicans and the harlots believed him: and ye, when ye had seen it, repented not afterward, that ye might believe him.

21:33.text: Hear another parable: There was a certain householder, which planted a vineyard, and hedged it round about, and digged a winepress in it, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into a far country:

21:34.text: And when the time of the fruit drew near, he sent his servants to the husbandmen, that they might receive the fruits of it.

21:35.text: And the husbandmen took his servants, and beat one, and killed another, and stoned another.

21:36.text: Again, he sent other servants more than the first: and they did unto them likewise.

21:37.text: But last of all he sent unto them his son, saying, They will reverence my son.

21:38.text: But when the husbandmen saw the son, they said among themselves, This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and let us seize on his inheritance.

21:39.text: And they caught him, and cast him out of the vineyard, and slew him.

21:40.text: When the lord therefore of the vineyard cometh, what will he do unto those husbandmen?

21:41.text: They say unto him, He will miserably destroy those wicked men, and will let out his vineyard unto other husbandmen, which shall render him the fruits in their seasons.

21:42.text: Jesus saith unto them, Did ye never read in the scriptures, The stone which the builders rejected, the same is become the head of the corner: this is the Lord's doing, and it is marvellous in our eyes?

21:43.text: Therefore say I unto you, The kingdom of God shall be taken from you, and given to a nation bringing forth the fruits thereof.

21:44.text: And whosoever shall fall on this stone shall be broken: but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.

21:45.text: And when the chief priests and Pharisees had heard his parables, they perceived that he spake of them.

21:46.text: But when they sought to lay hands on him, they feared the multitude, because they took him for a prophet.

21:47.text: And Jesus answered and spake unto them again by parables, and said,

21:48.text: The kingdom of heaven is like unto a certain king, which made a marriage for his son,

21:49.text: And sent forth his servants to call them that were bidden to the wedding: and they would not come.

21:50.text: Again, he sent forth other servants, saying, Tell them which are bidden, Behold, I have prepared my dinner: my oxen and my fatlings are killed, and all things are ready: come unto the marriage.

21:51.text: But they made light of it, and went their ways, one to his farm, another to his merchandise:

21:52.text: And the remnant took his servants, and entreated them spitefully, and slew them.

21:53.text: But when the king heard thereof, he was wroth: and he sent forth his armies, and destroyed those murderers, and burned up their city.

21:54.text: Then saith he to his servants, The wedding is ready, but they which were bidden were not worthy.

21:55.text: Go ye therefore into the highways, and as many as ye shall find, bid to the marriage.

21:56.text: So those servants went out into the highways, and gathered together all as many as they found, both bad and good: and the wedding was furnished with guests.

21:57.text: And when the king came in to see the guests, he saw there a man which had not on a wedding garment:

21:58.text: And he saith unto him, Friend, how camest thou in hither not having a wedding garment? And he was speechless.

21:59.text: Then said the king to the servants, Bind him hand and foot, and take him away, and cast him into outer darkness; there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

22:01.text: Now the feast of unleavened bread drew nigh, which is called the Passover.

22:02.text: And the chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him; for they feared the people.

22:03.text: Then entered Satan into Judas surnamed Iscariot, being of the number of the twelve.

22:04.text: And he went his way, and communed with the chief priests and captains, how he might betray him unto them.

22:05.text: And they were glad, and covenanted to give him money.

22:06.text: And he promised, and sought opportunity to betray him unto them in the absence of the multitude.

22:07.text: Then came the day of unleavened bread, when the passover must be killed.

22:08.text: And he sent Peter and John, saying, Go and prepare us the passover, that we may eat.

22:09.text: And they said unto him, Where wilt thou that we prepare?

22:10.text: And he said unto them, Behold, when ye are entered into the city, there shall a man meet you, bearing a pitcher of water; follow him into the house where he entereth in.

22:11.text: And ye shall say unto the goodman of the house, The Master saith unto thee, Where is the guestchamber, where I shall eat the passover with my disciples?

22:12.text: And he shall shew you a large upper room furnished: there make ready.

22:13.text: And they went, and found as he had said unto them: and they made ready the passover.

22:14.text: And when the hour was come, he sat down, and the twelve apostles with him.

22:15.text: And he said unto them, With desire I have desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer:

22:16.text: For I say unto you, I will not any more eat thereof, until it be fulfilled in the kingdom of God.

22:17.text: And he took the cup, and gave thanks, and said, Take this, and divide it among yourselves:

22:18.text: For I say unto you, I will not drink of the fruit of the vine, until the kingdom of God shall come.

22:19.text: And he took bread, and gave thanks, and brake it, and gave unto them, saying, This is my body which is given for you: this do in remembrance of me.

22:20.text: Likewise also the cup after supper, saying, This cup is the new testament in my blood, which is shed for you.

22:21.text: But, behold, the hand of him that betrayeth me is with me on the table.

22:22.text: And truly the Son of man goeth, as it was determined: but woe unto that man by whom he is betrayed!

22:23.text: And they began to enquire among themselves, which of them it was that should do this thing.

22:24.text: And there was also a strife among them, which of them should be accounted the greatest.

22:25.text: And he said unto them, The kings of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them; and they that exercise authority upon them are called benefactors.

22:26.text: But ye shall not be so: but he that is greatest among you, let him be as the younger; and he that is chief, as he that doth serve.

22:27.text: For whether is greater, he that sitteth at meat, or he that serveth? is not he that sitteth at meat? but I am among you as he that serveth.

22:28.text: Ye are they which have continued with me in my temptations.

22:29.text: And I appoint unto you a kingdom, as my Father hath appointed unto me;

22:30.text: That ye may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom, and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

22:31.text: And the Lord said, Simon, Simon, behold, Satan hath desired to have you, that he may sift you as wheat:

22:32.text: But I have prayed for thee, that thy faith fail not: and when thou art converted, strengthen thy brethren.

22:33.text: And he said unto him, Lord, I am ready to go with thee, both into prison, and to death.

22:34.text: And he said, I tell thee, Peter, the cock shall not crow this day, before that thou shalt thrice deny that thou knowest me.

22:35.text: And he said unto them, When I sent you without purse, and scrip, and shoes, lacked ye any thing? And they said, Nothing.

22:36.text: Then said he unto them, But now, he that hath a purse, let him take it, and likewise his scrip: and he that hath no sword, let him sell his garment, and buy one.

22:37.text: For I say unto you, that this that is written must yet be accomplished in me, And he was reckoned among the transgressors: for the things concerning me have an end.

22:38.text: And they said, Lord, behold, here are two swords. And he said unto them, It is enough.

22:39.text: And he came out, and went, as he was wont, to the mount of Olives; and his disciples also followed him.

22:40.text: And when he was at the place, he said unto them, Pray that ye enter not into temptation.

22:41.text: And he was withdrawn from them about a stone's cast, and kneeled down, and prayed,

22:42.text: Saying, Father, if thou be willing, remove this cup from me: nevertheless not my will, but thine, be done.

22:43.text: And there appeared an angel unto him from heaven, strengthening him.

22:44.text: And being in an agony he prayed more earnestly: and his sweat was as it were great drops of blood falling down to the ground.

22:45.text: And when he rose up from prayer, and was come to his disciples, he found them sleeping for sorrow,

22:46.text: And said unto them, Why sleep ye? rise and pray, lest ye enter into temptation.

22:47.text: And while he yet spake, behold a multitude, and he that was called Judas, one of the twelve, went before them, and drew near unto Jesus to kiss him.

22:48.text: But Jesus said unto him, Judas, betrayest thou the Son of man with a kiss?

22:49.text: When they which were about him saw what would follow, they said unto him, Lord, shall we smite with the sword?

22:50.text: And one of them smote the servant of the high priest, and cut off his right ear.

22:51.text: And Jesus answered and said, Suffer ye thus far. And he touched his ear, and healed him.

22:52.text: Then Jesus said unto the chief priests, and captains of the temple, and the elders, which were come to him, Be ye come out, as against a thief, with swords and staves?

22:53.text: When I was daily with you in the temple, ye stretched forth no hands against me: but this is your hour, and the power of darkness.

22:54.text: Then took they him, and led him, and brought him into the high priest's house. And Peter followed afar off.

22:55.text: And when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the hall, and were set down together, Peter sat down among them.

22:56.text: But a certain maid beheld him as he sat by the fire, and earnestly looked upon him, and said, This man was also with him.

22:57.text: And he denied him, saying, Woman, I know him not.

22:58.text: And after a little while another saw him, and said, Thou art also of them. And Peter said, Man, I am not.

22:59.text: And about the space of one hour after another confidently affirmed, saying, Of a truth this fellow also was with him: for he is a Galilaean.

23:01.text: And straightway in the morning the chief priests held a consultation with the elders and scribes and the whole council, and bound Jesus, and carried him away, and delivered him to Pilate.

23:02.text: And Pilate asked him, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answering said unto him, Thou sayest it.

23:03.text: And the chief priests accused him of many things: but he answered nothing.

23:04.text: And Pilate asked him again, saying, Answerest thou nothing? behold how many things they witness against thee.

23:05.text: But Jesus yet answered nothing; so that Pilate marvelled.

23:06.text: Now at that feast he released unto them one prisoner, whomsoever they desired.

23:07.text: And there was one named Barabbas, which lay bound with them that had made insurrection with him, who had committed murder in the insurrection.

23:08.text: And the multitude crying aloud began to desire him to do as he had ever done unto them.

23:09.text: But Pilate answered them, saying, Will ye that I release unto you the King of the Jews?

23:10.text: For he knew that the chief priests had delivered him for envy.

23:11.text: But the chief priests moved the people, that he should rather release Barabbas unto them.

23:12.text: And Pilate answered and said again unto them, What will ye then that I shall do unto him whom ye call the King of the Jews?

23:13.text: And they cried out again, Crucify him.

23:14.text: Then Pilate said unto them, Why, what evil hath he done? And they cried out the more exceedingly, Crucify him.

23:15.text: And so Pilate, willing to content the people, released Barabbas unto them, and delivered Jesus, when he had scourged him, to be crucified.

23:16.text: And the soldiers led him away into the hall, called Praetorium; and they call together the whole band.

23:17.text: And they clothed him with purple, and platted a crown of thorns, and put it about his head,

23:18.text: And began to salute him, Hail, King of the Jews!

23:19.text: And they smote him on the head with a reed, and did spit upon him, and bowing their knees worshipped him.

23:20.text: And when they had mocked him, they took off the purple from him, and put his own clothes on him, and led him out to crucify him.

23:21.text: And they compel one Simon a Cyrenian, who passed by, coming out of the country, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to bear his cross.

23:22.text: And they bring him unto the place Golgotha, which is, being interpreted, The place of a skull.

23:23.text: And they gave him to drink wine mingled with myrrh: but he received it not.

23:24.text: And when they had crucified him, they parted his garments, casting lots upon them, what every man should take.

23:25.text: And it was the third hour, and they crucified him.

23:26.text: And the superscription of his accusation was written over, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

23:27.text: And with him they crucify two thieves; the one on his right hand, and the other on his left.

23:28.text: And the scripture was fulfilled, which saith, And he was numbered with the transgressors.

23:29.text: And they that passed by railed on him, wagging their heads, and saying, Ah, thou that destroyest the temple, and buildest it in three days,

23:30.text: Save thyself, and come down from the cross.

23:31.text: Likewise also the chief priests mocking said among themselves with the scribes, He saved others; himself he cannot save.

23:32.text: Let Christ the King of Israel descend now from the cross, that we may see and believe. And they that were crucified with him reviled him.

23:33.text: And when the sixth hour was come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.

23:34.text: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani? which is, being interpreted, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?

23:35.text: And some of them that stood by, when they heard it, said, Behold, he calleth Elias.

23:36.text: And one ran and filled a spunge full of vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him to drink, saying, Let alone; let us see whether Elias will come to take him down.

23:37.text: And Jesus cried with a loud voice, and gave up the ghost.

23:38.text: And the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom.

23:39.text: And when the centurion, which stood over against him, saw that he so cried out, and gave up the ghost, he said, Truly this man was the Son of God.

23:40.text: There were also women looking on afar off: among whom was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;

23:41.text: Who also, when he was in Galilee, followed him, and ministered unto him; and many other women which came up with him unto Jerusalem.

23:42.text: And now when the even was come, because it was the preparation, that is, the day before the sabbath,

23:43.text: Joseph of Arimathaea, an honourable counsellor, which also waited for the kingdom of God, came, and went in boldly unto Pilate, and craved the body of Jesus.

23:44.text: And Pilate marvelled if he were already dead: and calling unto him the centurion, he asked him whether he had been any while dead.

23:45.text: And when he knew it of the centurion, he gave the body to Joseph.

23:46.text: And he bought fine linen, and took him down, and wrapped him in the linen, and laid him in a sepulchre which was hewn out of a rock, and rolled a stone unto the door of the sepulchre.

23:47.text: And Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses beheld where he was laid.

23:48.text: And when the sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James, and Salome, had bought sweet spices, that they might come and anoint him.

23:49.text: And very early in the morning the first day of the week, they came unto the sepulchre at the rising of the sun.

23:50.text: And they said among themselves, Who shall roll us away the stone from the door of the sepulchre?

23:51.text: And when they looked, they saw that the stone was rolled away: for it was very great.

23:52.text: And entering into the sepulchre, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, clothed in a long white garment; and they were affrighted.

23:53.text: And he saith unto them, Be not affrighted: Ye seek Jesus of Nazareth, which was crucified: he is risen; he is not here: behold the place where they laid him.

23:54.text: But go your way, tell his disciples and Peter that he goeth before you into Galilee: there shall ye see him, as he said unto you.

23:55.text: And they went out quickly, and fled from the sepulchre; for they trembled and were amazed: neither said they any thing to any man; for they were afraid.

23:56.text: Now when Jesus was risen early the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom he had cast seven devils.

23:57.text: And she went and told them that had been with him, as they mourned and wept.

23:58.text: And they, when they had heard that he was alive, and had been seen of her, believed not.

23:59.text: After that he appeared in another form unto two of them, as they walked, and went into the country.
